title: MySQL connections fail due to SQLite specific config in DbConfig
body:
I have set up a MySQL database using `systemctl start mysql` and it all works. The host and port are "localhost" and 3306 respectively with username "root".

I have filled these credentials in the `config.py` file as well and changed the `engine` parameter to `mysql`. 

Firstly I think the docstring for those functions are not updated because it calls for renaming of variables that are no longer present, but from what I figured the `name` under the `DbConfig` class refers to the database name.

Given all these, I am still unable to connect to the server. The following seem to be the issue:

1. The create_engine() command is not working because the interpreter never crosses that line of code (found through debug statements).
2. The database name passed to the mysql server is `.data/nettacker.db` which is invalid for MySQL databases and only works for SQLite. So the command CREATE DATABASE path/to/.data/nettacker.db gives an error.

The default config for DbConfig class is sqlite and that requires the nettacker.db file which is why the product works if no one tries to change the DbConfig.

Proposed solution:

1. Update the docstring for the DbConfig class
2. Use pymysql as a bridge to allow direct SQL connections and queries in the `mysql.py` file
3. Update the `db.py` file to allow both MySQL and SQLite
4. Increase the max connections for the server (user/admin has to do this)

I have tried these locally and they seem to work well. Let me know if you want me to push these changes for you to review.
author: pUrGe12

title: Migrate CI/CD to ubuntu-24.04
body:
Migrate CI/CD to ubuntu-24.04 runners (soon will be ubuntu-latest for everyone).

There are particular compatibility issues with docker image tests for [these versions](https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/blob/1463af88bcce5dbe5c9ae9bd466306141f464592/.github/workflows/ci_cd.yml#L213):
  - `24.0.6-1~ubuntu.22.04~jammy`
  - `23.0.6-1~ubuntu.22.04~jammy`
  - `20.10.13~3-0~ubuntu-jammy`

It seems the newer [distro](https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/dists/noble/pool/stable/amd64/) has 26 and 27 version (as for now). 

I expect it be the only problematic step and everything else should migrate smoothly
author: arkid15r

title: Can't install Nettacker if Python interpreter is 3.13.1
body:
Please describe the issue or question and share your OS and Python version.
_________________
**OS**: `Fedora`
**OS Version**: `41`
**Python Version**: `3.13.1`

I get this error after running _pipx install nettacker_ (as regular user)

_Some possibly relevant errors from pip install:
    ERROR: Ignored the following versions that require a different python version: 0.3.1a10 Requires-Python >=3.9,<3.13; 0.3.1a11 Requires-Python >=3.9,<3.13; 0.3.1a12 Requires-Python >=3.9,<3.13; 0.3.1a13 Requires-Python >=3.9,<3.13; 0.3.1a15 Requires-Python >=3.9,<3.13; 0.3.1a16 Requires-Python >=3.9,<3.13; 0.3.1a17 Requires-Python >=3.9,<3.13; 0.3.1a2 Requires-Python >=3.9,<3.13; 0.3.1a3 Requires-Python >=3.9,<3.13; 0.3.1a4 Requires-Python >=3.9,<3.13; 0.3.1a5 Requires-Python >=3.9,<3.13; 0.3.1a6 Requires-Python >=3.9,<3.13; 0.3.1a7 Requires-Python >=3.9,<3.13; 0.3.1a8 Requires-Python >=3.9,<3.13; 0.3.1a9 Requires-Python >=3.9,<3.13; 0.4.0 Requires-Python <3.13,>=3.9
    ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement nettacker (from versions: none)
    ERROR: No matching distribution found for nettacker_
author: q2dg
comments_list: [{'comment_id': 2566353074, 'issue_id': 2763415073, 'author': 'securestep9', 'body': 'Hi @q2dg it is a known issue - Nettacker is currently not compatible with Python 3.13\r\n\r\nPlease use an older version of Python e.g. 3.12.6  or 3.11.11 (you can run several versions. of Python in parallel using something like pyenv) or use the Docker version.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 12, 31, 11, 6, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]
comment_thread:
securestep9 on (2024-12-31 11:06:54 UTC): Hi @q2dg it is a known issue - Nettacker is currently not compatible with Python 3.13

Please use an older version of Python e.g. 3.12.6  or 3.11.11 (you can run several versions. of Python in parallel using something like pyenv) or use the Docker version.

title: Translations needed for comparison functionality messages
body:
We are looking for contributors to help translate the following scan-comparison-related messages into various languages. If you are a native speaker of any of the languages listed below, please consider contributing a translation for the following messages(no Google Translate please, only native speaker translations):

```
compare_report_path_filename: "the file-path to store the compare_scan report"
no_scan_to_compare: "the scan_id to be compared not found"
compare_report_saved: "compare results saved in {0}"
build_compare_report: "building compare report"
finish_build_report: "Finished building compare report"

```

Languages needed:

~~Arabic (ar.yaml)~~
Bengali (bn.yaml)
German (de.yaml)
Greek (el.yaml)
Spanish (es.yaml)
Persian (fa.yaml)
French (fr.yaml)
~~Hindi (hi.yaml)~~
Armenian (hy.yaml)
Indonesian (id.yaml)
Italian (it.yaml)
Hebrew (iw.yaml)
Japanese (ja.yaml)
Korean (ko.yaml)
Dutch (nl.yaml)
Pashto (ps.yaml)
Portuguese (Brazil) (pt-br.yaml)
Russian (ru.yaml)
Turkish (tr.yaml)
Urdu (ur.yaml)
Vietnamese (vi.yaml)
Chinese (Simplified) (zh-cn.yaml)

These YAML files are located here: https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/tree/master/nettacker/locale
Feel free to submit a pull request with your translations. Thank you for your contributions!
author: securestep9

tadash10 on (2024-10-01 02:19:09 UTC): hi ! I'm a native Spanish speaker .Do I make a pull request with the translation I already made? Do I have to take any precautions? Thank you!

arkid15r on (2024-10-01 17:57:35 UTC): @tadash10 if you want to update `es` localization please go ahead and create a regular GitHub PR. Thanks for contributing!

Phantomwise on (2024-10-26 13:09:43 UTC): Hi! Would I need to follow the part of the contribution guidelines about testing code in order to submit a french translation ? I don't know much python and that seems way over my head :sweat_smile:

arkid15r on (2024-10-26 16:15:18 UTC): Hi @Phantomwise, it's always a good idea to test functionality and/or write unit tests for your code. For l10n related PRs it's not always required (see similar PR -- https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/pull/934). Just making sure unit tests and CI/CD green after your changes should be enough.

Phantomwise on (2024-10-26 17:13:04 UTC): Ok, I thought I could do just the translation part, but if it requires testing I'll have to pass, I'm not qualified for that sadly. I'm not a developer, just looking for translation requests.

arkid15r on (2024-10-26 17:37:56 UTC): All you need to do is just make sure the app works after your changes. If that's out of your knowledge/qualification -- just go ahead and translate it similar to how it's done in #934 (no test added in that PR). The CI/CD will take care of that.

Thank you for the contribution!

If given the opportunity, I will ensure the translations are accurate and culturally appropriate. Please let me know if I can proceed or if there are specific guidelines I should follow.

Thank you!

title: i keep gitting the smae error it making me pissed
body: when i runned python nettacker.py -i owasp.org -s -m port_scan it gave me a error saying [2024-05-05 01:30:55][X] file "/home/kali/Nettacker/.data/results/results_2024_05_05_01_30_53_ggruaklqqz.html" is not writable!
author: aliisawesome160
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 2104061259, 'issue_id': 2279336745, 'author': 'securestep9', 'body': 'check and change /home/kali/Nettacker/.data/  and /home/kali/Nettacker/.data/results folder permissions to be writeable. 
you can also use -o <filename> switch to write the scan results into another file, for example:

```
python nettacker.py -i owasp.org -s -m port_scan -o /tmp/results.html
python nettacker.py -i owasp.org -s -m port_scan -o /tmp/results.csv
```

^ this will put the scan results in the /tmp/results.html or  /tmp/results.csv  (nettacker also support .txt and .json formats)', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 10, 7, 20, 40, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]
comment_thread:
securestep9 (Assginee) on (2024-05-10 07:20:40 UTC): check and change /home/kali/Nettacker/.data/  and /home/kali/Nettacker/.data/results folder permissions to be writeable. 
you can also use -o <filename> switch to write the scan results into another file, for example:

```
python nettacker.py -i owasp.org -s -m port_scan -o /tmp/results.html
python nettacker.py -i owasp.org -s -m port_scan -o /tmp/results.csv
```

^ this will put the scan results in the /tmp/results.html or  /tmp/results.csv  (nettacker also support .txt and .json formats)

title: Vulnerbilities in profile not found
body: when i start --profile vulnerabilities the nettacker give me not found error
author: djpoker
comments_list:

title: Same 3 Ports and Never ANY Results
body:
Maybe it's because I'm new to bug bounty hunting/pentesting, but no matter what I do, I seem to get the same ports scanned with no results to show in the report. I have tried the following modules to no success (my screenshot here shows 1 example of its failure):

subdomain_scan
subdomain_takeover_vuln
admin_scan
wordpress_version_scan

What am I missing or doing wrong? How do I use this tool correctly, or is it currently just broken? 

Because after completing the scan shown in the photograph, the report showed nothing of value (to my knowledge anyway) and almost no information altogether.

{"timeout": 3.0, "host": "arkoselabs.com", "ports": "443", "method": "tcp_connect_send_and_receive", "response": {"ssl_flag": false, "conditions_results": {"http": ["HTTP/1.1 400", "Content-Length: 915", "Content-Type: ", "Server: "]}}}

That's as much as I figured out from the wordpress_version_scan report ^
_________________

**OS**: `Kali Linux`

**OS Version**: `kali-linux-2023.4`

**Python Version**: `3.11.8`

![nettacker_fail](https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/assets/46658915/517c8fc5-bcc3-4940-81b3-31f7f2ccfcb4)
author: spacezero20
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 1975117111, 'issue_id': 2165100555, 'author': 'Captain-T2004', 'body': 'Ok so a basic idea of why you are seeing the same ports after any scans is this, so how the tool works is it first perform a port_scan on the given target(s) and determine the open ports on the target(s). After that it loads your selected module and try to scan according to those modules, for example in this case the wordpress_version_scan sends a request to the "/wp-admin/install.php" endpoint on the specified target and on all the different ports that are given in the module(80,443 in this case). After that it checks for the response and try to match the provided conditions in the module to the response. If the conditions are satisfied then it outputs it as successful scan and show the output in the graph along with the module name, port and target. If not then it only shows output of the other scans that were successful. In your case it was unable to match the required conditions to get a successful response so it only shows the output of the successful scan i.e. port_scan. I will look into this scan module to find why it wasn't working for you, but usually if it detects something it will show you the output.

PS: You can look at how the scans are being done by turning on the verbose output using the -v argument.

Hope this helps.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 3, 3, 10, 38, 35, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 1975205561, 'issue_id': 2165100555, 'author': 'Captain-T2004', 'body': 'Took me a while to figure it out but i found out why it was not working. The problem was a missing "www", So as the target you put in didn't contain a www the requests sent to the target didn't contain it either and due to some reason the response is altered(in this case there is no response from the target if the end point is accessed without the www in the url). I have tested the wordpress_version_scan module and can confirm it works. I am attaching the results below.

Command used: "python3 nettacker.py -i https://www.arkoselabs.com -m wordpress_version_scan"
OS: Pop!_OS 22.04 LTS x86_64 

Output:

![image](https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/assets/126911424/530e4e8c-e783-4eae-bf6a-fddafb3e09f4)', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 3, 3, 15, 58, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 1975375234, 'issue_id': 2165100555, 'author': 'securestep9', 'body': 'The module and Nettacker works as designed. By asking to scan https://arkoselabs.com Nettacker is connecting to the precise target and that target  does not have wordpress - the response from the server is a 301 redirect which Nettacker is not following intentionally (because that would take the scan to a different target taking the pen test/scan "out of scope" (sorry I have to explain this: "staying in scope of an engagement" a concept familiar to people who perform penetration testing/bug bounty ad it means that the security tester are only testing what they are explicitly allowed/authorised to test).   


If you wish to scan all subdomains of arkoseblabs.com the command you should have used:

`python nettacker.py --skip-service-discovery -i arkoselabs.com -m wordpress_version_scan -s 
`

the 
`-s
`

means "run all the modules listed for all subdomains of the target"


Before scanning any target with Nettacker make sure you have explicit permission (either a security penetration testing contract/agreement or being in-scope of the Bug Bounty programme which allows to run security scans on target subdomains/IP addresses', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 3, 3, 22, 8, 44, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]
comment_thread:
Captain-T2004 on (2024-03-03 10:38:35 UTC): Ok so a basic idea of why you are seeing the same ports after any scans is this, so how the tool works is it first perform a port_scan on the given target(s) and determine the open ports on the target(s). After that it loads your selected module and try to scan according to those modules, for example in this case the wordpress_version_scan sends a request to the "/wp-admin/install.php" endpoint on the specified target and on all the different ports that are given in the module(80,443 in this case). After that it checks for the response and try to match the provided conditions in the module to the response. If the conditions are satisfied then it outputs it as successful scan and show the output in the graph along with the module name, port and target. If not then it only shows output of the other scans that were successful. In your case it was unable to match the required conditions to get a successful response so it only shows the output of the successful scan i.e. port_scan. I will look into this scan module to find why it wasn't working for you, but usually if it detects something it will show you the output.

PS: You can look at how the scans are being done by turning on the verbose output using the -v argument.

Hope this helps.

Captain-T2004 on (2024-03-03 15:58:57 UTC): Took me a while to figure it out but i found out why it was not working. The problem was a missing "www", So as the target you put in didn't contain a www the requests sent to the target didn't contain it either and due to some reason the response is altered(in this case there is no response from the target if the end point is accessed without the www in the url). I have tested the wordpress_version_scan module and can confirm it works. I am attaching the results below.

Command used: "python3 nettacker.py -i https://www.arkoselabs.com -m wordpress_version_scan"
OS: Pop!_OS 22.04 LTS x86_64 

Output:

![image](https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/assets/126911424/530e4e8c-e783-4eae-bf6a-fddafb3e09f4)

securestep9 on (2024-03-03 22:08:44 UTC): The module and Nettacker works as designed. By asking to scan https://arkoselabs.com Nettacker is connecting to the precise target and that target  does not have wordpress - the response from the server is a 301 redirect which Nettacker is not following intentionally (because that would take the scan to a different target taking the pen test/scan "out of scope" (sorry I have to explain this: "staying in scope of an engagement" a concept familiar to people who perform penetration testing/bug bounty ad it means that the security tester are only testing what they are explicitly allowed/authorised to test).   


If you wish to scan all subdomains of arkoseblabs.com the command you should have used:

`python nettacker.py --skip-service-discovery -i arkoselabs.com -m wordpress_version_scan -s 
`

the 
`-s
`

means "run all the modules listed for all subdomains of the target"


Before scanning any target with Nettacker make sure you have explicit permission (either a security penetration testing contract/agreement or being in-scope of the Bug Bounty programme which allows to run security scans on target subdomains/IP addresses

title: pagination feature needed in WebUI Results and Crawler search results
body:
at the moment Nettacker WebUI does not have any pagination - only 'Previous' and 'Next' buttons are shown for navigation. We need a pagination feature allowing the user to navigate between pages, jump to a specific page as well as the first page and last page (see attached screenshot explaining proposed functionality)
![Screenshot 2024-02-02 at 15 00 11](https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/assets/20112179/2abddaa8-a65a-427a-840e-c43c0dce382e)

title: Reorganize Profile Section in Web Module for Improved Usability
body:
## Issue Summary:
The current profile section in the web module appears cluttered with multiple protocols and products, making it challenging for users to navigate and select profiles efficiently. This issue proposes reorganizing the profile section to enhance user experience.

## Proposed Changes:

- **Separate Section for Profiles:**
  Introduce a separate section for profiles to declutter the existing profile selection interface.

- **Improved Categorization:**
  Group profiles based on protocols and products to make it more intuitive for users.

#### Screenshot:
![Screenshot_20231226_010406](https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/assets/50882504/13d1b55e-e8bf-49ee-91d0-2a6cf0cf9cc7)

## Implementation Plan:

- Identify the relevant HTML templates and JavaScript files responsible for rendering the web interface.
- Introduce modifications to separate the profile section and improve categorization.

## Benefits:

- Enhances user experience by providing a more organized and user-friendly profile selection interface.
- Simplifies the process of selecting profiles, especially when dealing with multiple protocols and products.
author: prbhtkumr

title: Data missing on /logs/get_json?target=
body:
Please describe the issue or question and share your OS and Python version.
_________________
OS: x
Ubuntu
OS Version: x
22.04.2 LTS
Python Version: x
Python 3.10.12

Hi! in my program that i made to use nettacker i would like to replicate a function of the real UI , the function where you go on crawler and click on a host and inside there is a html table with all the events of that host. i currently did it with /logs/get_json?target=192.168.254.12, in response to that i get this json:

`[{"scan_unique_id": "xlcbpjisyjvzbcgidjzjgqxuiztvtqkg", "target": "192.168.254.12", "port": "22", "event": "host: 192.168.254.12 method: tcp_connect_send_and_receive ports: '22' timeout: 3.0 conditions: ssh: - the problem here is that the module name is missing, if we go on the nettacker UI and press on a host we see a table with the same data that i have in the json but there is also the module name, which i can't figure out where is located.

![tablebett](https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/assets/118749390/13dc0e37-e987-4593-9928-6ff10e18839b)

author: ErtyDess
comments_list: [{'comment_id': 1845199550, 'issue_id': 1994252603, 'author': 'Captain-T2004', 'body': '@ErtyDess The problem you are facing is because the logs found in ***/logs/get_json/*** does not contain the information you require, in order to obtain  the actual result of the scan that has full information about the scan_modules and everything is to get the result json from ***/results/get_json***. In order to get the result from ***/results/get_json*** you will need the id of the scan that can be found using the ***/results/get_list***, after that you can use that id in form of ***/results/get_json?id=$ID*** to get the result json that contains all your required information. You can refer to API wiki for more information.\r\n\r\nLink to wiki: https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/wiki/API#get-a-scan-result', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2023, 12, 7, 11, 46, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]
comment_thread:
Captain-T2004 on (2023-12-07 11:46:19 UTC): @ErtyDess The problem you are facing is because the logs found in ***/logs/get_json/*** does not contain the information you require, in order to obtain  the actual result of the scan that has full information about the scan_modules and everything is to get the result json from ***/results/get_json***. In order to get the result from ***/results/get_json*** you will need the id of the scan that can be found using the ***/results/get_list***, after that you can use that id in form of ***/results/get_json?id=$ID*** to get the result json that contains all your required information. You can refer to API wiki for more information.

Link to wiki: https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/wiki/API#get-a-scan-result

body:

Ubuntu
OS Version: x
22.04.2 LTS
Python Version: x
Python 3.10.12

How can i remove all the hosts and the scans i've done? to clear all basically
author: ErtyDess
comments_list: [{'comment_id': 1810597820, 'issue_id': 1993028398, 'author': 'securestep9', 'body': 'All Nettacker data is stored in the .data folder where you will find the nettacker.db sql lite database , the results and the tmp folder.\r\n\r\nyou can simply delete the ".data" folder to clear all history (or rname it to something else in case you want to keep it) and re-start Nettacker - it will create a fresh ".data" folder with blank database', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2023, 11, 14, 16, 21, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 1811961324, 'issue_id': 1993028398, 'author': 'ErtyDess', 'body': 'Thank you !!', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2023, 11, 15, 7, 51, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 1814021748, 'issue_id': 1993028398, 'author': 'ErtyDess', 'body': "EDIT: For everyone that needs to do it, DON'T remove the whole directory because it won't work anymore, instead remove only the content inside it and do docker compose down and then restart it with docker compose up -d", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2023, 11, 16, 8, 50, 21, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]
comment_thread:
securestep9 on (2023-11-14 16:21:08 UTC): All Nettacker data is stored in the .data folder where you will find the nettacker.db sql lite database , the results and the tmp folder.

you can simply delete the ".data" folder to clear all history (or rname it to something else in case you want to keep it) and re-start Nettacker - it will create a fresh ".data" folder with blank database

ErtyDess (Issue Creator) on (2023-11-15 07:51:01 UTC): Thank you !!

ErtyDess (Issue Creator) on (2023-11-16 08:50:21 UTC): EDIT: For everyone that needs to do it, DON'T remove the whole directory because it won't work anymore, instead remove only the content inside it and do docker compose down and then restart it with docker compose up -d

Sure - also check out #550', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2023, 11, 14, 16, 24, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 1831918915, 'issue_id': 1987110191, 'author': 'Captain-T2004', 'body': "I haven't been able to recreate this issue on any PC i have tried. The library py3DNS (library_name = DNS) is actually not being used anywhere in the program as far as I can see, I believe that is why in the issue #550 changing the library_name from DNS to dns worked because it is imported from pythondns library instead of py3DNS.

title: Avoid warning message when running app.
body:
Hello, I'm testing the application and I want to run the API in a production environment.  

```
python nettacker.py --start-api --api-host 0.0.0.0  --api-access-key HERECOMESTHESECRETKEY

```

how can i run this command with gunicorn in production?
author: cferreirasuazo
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 2629531867, 'issue_id': 1909451817, 'author': 'pUrGe12', 'body': 'Hey there! As far as I am aware you can run such a script using a subprocess as well. So if for example you're trying to host your backend on render, then you can create a subprocess that runs this code in the server in a file named `app` like 

```py
from flask import Flask
import subprocess

app = Flask(__name__)

@app.route('/start-api', methods=['GET'])
def start_api():
    subprocess.Popen(['python3', 'nettacker.py', '--start-api', '--api-host', '0.0.0.0', '--api-access-key', 'HERECOMESTHESECRETKEY'])
    return 'started', 200

if __name__ == "__main__":
    app.run()
```

and call gunicorn as such (adjust the -w value to the number of workers you want, based on traffic)

```sh
gunicorn -w 4 -b 0.0.0.0:8000 app:app
```

So, in that case all you will have to do is trigger the /start-api endpoint and you're good to go.

Does this make sense? Please let me know if you have any further questions.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2025, 2, 2, 19, 54, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]
comment_thread:
pUrGe12 on (2025-02-02 19:54:18 UTC): Hey there! As far as I am aware you can run such a script using a subprocess as well. So if for example you're trying to host your backend on render, then you can create a subprocess that runs this code in the server in a file named `app` like 

```py
from flask import Flask
import subprocess

app = Flask(__name__)

@app.route('/start-api', methods=['GET'])
def start_api():
    subprocess.Popen(['python3', 'nettacker.py', '--start-api', '--api-host', '0.0.0.0', '--api-access-key', 'HERECOMESTHESECRETKEY'])
    return 'started', 200

if __name__ == "__main__":
    app.run()
```

and call gunicorn as such (adjust the -w value to the number of workers you want, based on traffic)

```sh
gunicorn -w 4 -b 0.0.0.0:8000 app:app
```

So, in that case all you will have to do is trigger the /start-api endpoint and you're good to go.

Does this make sense? Please let me know if you have any further questions.

title: Enhancement: Provide More Command Examples for New Users
body:
In your Python code (nettacker.py), consider adding more command examples. This helps new users who may find it difficult to create the right commands when they use your code for the first time. It makes it easier for them to write the correct code.

**Like that:-** 

nettacker -L en -v -o results.txt -i target.com -m ftp_brute,ssh_brute -u admin -P passwords.txt -g 21,22 --start-api --api-host 0.0.0.0 --api-port 5000

title: ssh_brute: Detect open dropbear server
body:
# Issue

Currently, the brute modules (at least ssh) do not scan for empty passwords.

*Update: This does not seem to affect openssh servers and could only be reproduced on dropbear ssh servers so far.*

# Setup

Container running an open SSH server (aka, user=root, password="") in the same network as the Nettacker container.
I can successfully connect to the SSH server from inside the Nettacker container using `ssh root@<ip>` without password prompt.

# Expected behavior

Nettacker should detect a passwordless SSH server.

# Actual behaviour

1. By default, Nettacker does not attempt to connect without password.
2. Running `python3 nettacker.py -v -i <ip> -m ssh_brute -u "root" -p ""` will fall back to default password list (since passwords is empty)
3. Creating a passwordlist file only containing a newline and running `python3 nettacker.py -v -i <ip> -m ssh_brute -u "root" --passwords-list=passwords.txt` will use an empty password, but will still fail to detect the open SSH server:  
```
{"timeout": 3.0, "host": "172.23.0.3", "ports": "22", "usernames": "root", "passwords": "", "method": "ssh_brute_force", "response": {"condition_type": "or", "conditions_results": []}}
[2023-07-09 12:24:45][+] process-1|ssh_brute|172.23.0.3| finished module thread number 1 from 1
+----------------------------+------------+-------------+------+----------+
|            date            |   target   | module_name | port |   logs   |
+============================+============+=============+======+==========+
| 2023-07-09 12:24:44.491141 | 172.23.0.3 | port_scan   | 22   | Detected |
+----------------------------+------------+-------------+------+----------+
| 2023-07-09 12:24:44.507036 | 172.23.0.3 | port_scan   | 80   | Detected |
+----------------------------+------------+-------------+------+----------+
```

# Suggested solution

Nettacker should, regardless of provided passwords, always attempt to connect without providing a password.

# Nettacker Version
`owasp/nettacker:0.3.1` container image
author: Jasper-Ben
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 1924151786, 'issue_id': 1795382255, 'author': 'Captain-T2004', 'body': 'This is a genuine issue and I would like to fix this. @securestep9, kindly assign me this issue.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 2, 2, 15, 53, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 1932422820, 'issue_id': 1795382255, 'author': 'Captain-T2004', 'body': '@Jasper-Ben, while recreating this issue. I have found that nettacker is successfully able to identify the open ssh server. I have created a password less ssh server running on a docker container to recreate the issue.

Dockerfile to build the ssh server container:
***
FROM ubuntu:latest

RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y openssh-server

RUN useradd -ms /bin/bash myuser
RUN echo "myuser:"| chpasswd -e

RUN mkdir /var/run/sshd
COPY sshd_config /etc/ssh/
RUN passwd -d myuser
EXPOSE 22

CMD ["/usr/sbin/sshd", "-D"]
***

sshd_config file:
***
PermitRootLogin no
PasswordAuthentication yes
PermitEmptyPasswords yes
PubkeyAuthentication no
ChallengeResponseAuthentication no
UsePAM yes
***
Nettacker version:0.3.2
OS: Pop OS 22.04

If you have setup the ssh server in any other way kindly share the details...
![image](https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/assets/126911424/c4778e0a-71a0-4e8d-9871-6f8f9ede768b)', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 2, 7, 16, 29, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 1932442116, 'issue_id': 1795382255, 'author': 'Jasper-Ben', 'body': '@Captain-T2004 huh, interesting. I will check again soon (hopefully tomorrow)', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 2, 7, 16, 39, 36, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 1932553735, 'issue_id': 1795382255, 'author': 'Jasper-Ben', 'body': 'Ok, I couldn't let it rest until tomorrow :sweat_smile:

So the "good" news is: I am (probably) not stupid, in my setup I am still unable to detect the open SSH server.

```bash
# ssh root@172.20.0.2
root@b4a70f4bb3f1:~# 
```

```bash
# python3 nettacker.py -v -i 172.20.0.2 -m ssh_brute

+----------------------------+------------+-------------+------+----------+
|            date            |   target   | module_name | port |   logs   |
+============================+============+=============+======+==========+
| 2024-02-07 17:25:35.715329 | 172.20.0.2 | port_scan   | 22   | Detected |
+----------------------------+------------+-------------+------+----------+
| 2024-02-07 17:25:35.723765 | 172.20.0.2 | port_scan   | 80   | Detected |
+----------------------------+------------+-------------+------+----------+
```

Unfortunately, I cannot publish the ssh server container here for IP reasons, but I will try to reproduce this behavior in a minimal setup.

Noteworthy: We are using dropbear and not openssh, so first thing I will try again with an open dropbear server on an off-the-shelf Debian container', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 2, 7, 17, 37, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 1932610801, 'issue_id': 1795382255, 'author': 'Jasper-Ben', 'body': "P.S.: can you please send me the command you used to run nettacker? Maybe I'm doing something wrong there?", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 2, 7, 18, 12, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 1932702899, 'issue_id': 1795382255, 'author': 'Jasper-Ben', 'body': 'Ok, I was able to reproduce the issue with the following Dockerfile:

```Dockerfile
FROM debian:bookworm-slim

RUN apt-get update \
    && apt-get install -y dropbear \
    && passwd --delete root \
    && rm -rf /var/apt/lists

CMD ["/usr/sbin/dropbear", "-B", "-F"] 
```
Using your Dockerfile I was able to detect the open SSH server.

So this indeed is related to dropbear... :thinking: I still think this is a valid issue, since detection should work regardless of SSH server implementation. I will change the title accordingly though.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 2, 7, 19, 13, 27, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 1932719482, 'issue_id': 1795382255, 'author': 'Jasper-Ben', 'body': 'I also just double checked: Nettacker **will** detect a dropbear server with a weak password (e.g.: `python3 nettacker.py -v -i 172.20.0.4 -m ssh_brute -u root -p "root"`) so this issue really is limited to dropbear without a password.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 2, 7, 19, 24, 20, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 1933075661, 'issue_id': 1795382255, 'author': 'securestep9', 'body': 'If you look at how SSH module is implemented in Nettacker you will see that it is using Paramiko here:==>

https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/blob/e71b449b900cf2b4b289dacdb58adb7351c37328/core/module_protocols/core_ssh.py#L21

The Dropbear authentication It is apparently a known issue with Paramiko according to this StackOverflow article: 
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/71749222/paramiko-authentication-to-server-with-no-password-fails  - the same article suggests a workaround:

```
client = paramiko.SSHClient()
client.set_missing_host_key_policy(paramiko.AutoAddPolicy())
# Workaround for no authentication:
# https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/issues/890#issuecomment-906893725
try:
    client.connect(host, port=port, username=username, password=password)
except paramiko.ssh_exception.AuthenticationException as e:
    if not password:
        client.get_transport().auth_none(username)
    else:
        raise e

```
@Jasper-Ben - are you able to test that the StackOverflow-suggested workaround fixes your problem with Dropbear in your local fork of Nettacker? If yes, feel free to submit a PR', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 2, 7, 23, 0, 48, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 1933432699, 'issue_id': 1795382255, 'author': 'Captain-T2004', 'body': '> If you look at how SSH module is implemented in Nettacker you will see that it is using Paramiko here:==>

Captain-T2004 on (2024-02-02 15:53:02 UTC): This is a genuine issue and I would like to fix this. @securestep9, kindly assign me this issue.

Captain-T2004 on (2024-02-07 16:29:54 UTC): @Jasper-Ben, while recreating this issue. I have found that nettacker is successfully able to identify the open ssh server. I have created a password less ssh server running on a docker container to recreate the issue.

Dockerfile to build the ssh server container:
***
FROM ubuntu:latest

RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y openssh-server

RUN useradd -ms /bin/bash myuser
RUN echo "myuser:"| chpasswd -e

RUN mkdir /var/run/sshd
COPY sshd_config /etc/ssh/
RUN passwd -d myuser
EXPOSE 22

CMD ["/usr/sbin/sshd", "-D"]
***

sshd_config file:
***
PermitRootLogin no
PasswordAuthentication yes
PermitEmptyPasswords yes
PubkeyAuthentication no
ChallengeResponseAuthentication no
UsePAM yes
***

Jasper-Ben (Issue Creator) on (2024-02-07 17:37:50 UTC): Ok, I couldn't let it rest until tomorrow :sweat_smile:

So the "good" news is: I am (probably) not stupid, in my setup I am still unable to detect the open SSH server.

```

Unfortunately, I cannot publish the ssh server container here for IP reasons, but I will try to reproduce this behavior in a minimal setup.

Noteworthy: We are using dropbear and not openssh, so first thing I will try again with an open dropbear server on an off-the-shelf Debian container

Jasper-Ben (Issue Creator) on (2024-02-07 18:12:54 UTC): P.S.: can you please send me the command you used to run nettacker? Maybe I'm doing something wrong there?

Jasper-Ben (Issue Creator) on (2024-02-07 19:13:27 UTC): Ok, I was able to reproduce the issue with the following Dockerfile:

```Dockerfile
FROM debian:bookworm-slim

RUN apt-get update \
    && apt-get install -y dropbear \
    && passwd --delete root \
    && rm -rf /var/apt/lists

CMD ["/usr/sbin/dropbear", "-B", "-F"] 
```
Using your Dockerfile I was able to detect the open SSH server.

So this indeed is related to dropbear... :thinking: I still think this is a valid issue, since detection should work regardless of SSH server implementation. I will change the title accordingly though.

Jasper-Ben (Issue Creator) on (2024-02-07 19:24:20 UTC): I also just double checked: Nettacker **will** detect a dropbear server with a weak password (e.g.: `python3 nettacker.py -v -i 172.20.0.4 -m ssh_brute -u root -p "root"`) so this issue really is limited to dropbear without a password.

title: Release 0.3.1
body: prepare the new release switching to semantic versioning. We are still on our 3rd minor version, so 0.0.3 becomes -> 0.3.x branch to allow for module and patch releases on 0.3 core.
author: securestep9

title: new module to scan for MoveIt versions
body:
we need a new module to scan the targets for MoveIt versions. Due to MoveIt zero-day CVE-2023-34362 causing havoc and numerous ransomware and data breaches it would be useful to help the community to scan for MoveIt in their networks.

The vulnerable versions of MoveIt are listed in https://community.progress.com/s/article/MOVEit-Transfer-Critical-Vulnerability-15June2023


```
(15.0.1, 15.0.2) 
(14.1.5, 14.1.6)  
(14.0.4, 14.0.5)
(13.1.4, 13.1.5) 
(13.0.6, 13.0.7)  
(12.1.6)
(12.0 and earlier)
```

References:

* https://arstechnica.com/security/2023/06/casualties-keep-growing-in-this-months-mass-exploitation-of-moveit-0-day/
* https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/siemens-energy-confirms-data-breach-after-moveit-data-theft-attack/
* https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/millions-of-oregon-louisiana-state-ids-stolen-in-moveit-breach/
* https://techmonitor.ai/technology/cybersecurity/moveit-transfer-dublin-airport-cyberattack-cl0p
author: securestep9

title: GitHub showing Nettacker as HTML project instead of Python
body: GitHub is incorrectly detecting the main language of Nettacker as  HTML. We can force it to detect it as Python by using .gitattributes file in the repo
author: securestep9

title: New module citrix_cve_2023_24488_vuln
body: a module is needed to detect the latest Citrix XSS and open redirect CVE-2023-24488 for which a POC was published on 29-Jun-2023. Thousands of organisations worldwide using Citrix ADC and Citrix Gateway are affected
author: securestep9

title: New Module: http_redirect_scan
body:
**http_redirect_scan** module checks if a target webserver returns an 3xx http status code and logs it along with the redirection URL as specified in the Location response header . This can be very useful for recon as some redirections can be going to a subdomain/URL not exposed anywhere else, the redirection can go to a login page and include an auth token/session id in the URL etc. 

Additionally understanding the redirections within subdomains can help you identify any unauthorised or malicious redirects that may have been set up by cybercriminals. By regularly monitoring and auditing these redirects on the subdomains of your organisation you can mitigate the risk of phishing attacks and subdomain hijacking
author: securestep9

title: New Module: http_status_scan
body: http_status_scan module simply returns the http status code (e.g. 200/301/400/401/403 etc). This can be useful to quickly understand which web servers are actually delivering content (http status code 200) or redirecting elsewhere or require authentication/behind a WAF etc
author: securestep9

title: gcc and libssl-dev not found in docker-compose build
body:
after doing the quick setup command I did that's shown in the README, i get 2 errors in the 7th step (out of 12) in the docker-compose:
```
E: Unable to locate package libssl-dev
E: Unable to locate package gcc
```
_________________
**OS**: `Fedora 36`

**OS Version**: `6.1.7-100.fc36.x86_64`

**Python Version**: `3.10.9`
author: kernelwernel
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 1409723736, 'issue_id': 1563273532, 'author': 'itsdivyanshjain', 'body': 'directly use this command `apt install libssl-dev gcc` and re run the script and let me know is it working or not.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2023, 1, 31, 4, 7, 40, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 1414214012, 'issue_id': 1563273532, 'author': 'kernelwernel', 'body': "It does, but i had to add some extra things to the Dockerfile to actually make it work. Idk if anybody in the team wants to implement the extra docker commands to the project, but i'll share it anyway:
```
RUN apt-get update -y && apt-get dist-upgrade -y
RUN sed -i -e 's/archive.ubuntu.com\|security.ubuntu.com/old-releases.ubuntu.com/g' /etc/apt/sources.list
RUN apt install gcc libssl-dev -y
```", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2023, 2, 2, 18, 55, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]
comment_thread:
itsdivyanshjain on (2023-01-31 04:07:40 UTC): directly use this command `apt install libssl-dev gcc` and re run the script and let me know is it working or not.

kernelwernel (Issue Creator) on (2023-02-02 18:55:49 UTC): It does, but i had to add some extra things to the Dockerfile to actually make it work. Idk if anybody in the team wants to implement the extra docker commands to the project, but i'll share it anyway:
```
RUN apt-get update -y && apt-get dist-upgrade -y
RUN sed -i -e 's/archive.ubuntu.com\|security.ubuntu.com/old-releases.ubuntu.com/g' /etc/apt/sources.list
RUN apt install gcc libssl-dev -y
```

comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 2631066640, 'issue_id': 1402239067, 'author': 'pUrGe12', 'body': "Okay I haven't completely boiled this down to the root cause, but the issue probably comes due to the number of parallel threads being used. When I ran the same code using only 100 threads it worked. I tracked it down to the `wait_for_threads_to_finish` so basically if you add even a small delay there through `time.sleep(0.02)` right after the function definition, you can run this command with 1100 threads.

Adding the line

```py
import asyncio
asyncio.set_event_loop_policy(None)
```
to `app.py` in the beginning didn't work.

I am trying to find the reason for this", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2025, 2, 3, 13, 52, 27, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]
comment_thread:
pUrGe12 on (2025-02-03 13:52:27 UTC): Okay I haven't completely boiled this down to the root cause, but the issue probably comes due to the number of parallel threads being used. When I ran the same code using only 100 threads it worked. I tracked it down to the `wait_for_threads_to_finish` so basically if you add even a small delay there through `time.sleep(0.02)` right after the function definition, you can run this command with 1100 threads.

Adding the line

```py
import asyncio
asyncio.set_event_loop_policy(None)
```
to `app.py` in the beginning didn't work.

I am trying to find the reason for this

title: database lock issue
body:
Hi,

in some modules when there are a lots of events submitting to db, i got a lot of failure error with database lock, we need to re-architect the whole thing, it use a lots of IO, unnecessary memory, CPU, etc.

Bests. Ali.
author: Ali-Razmjoo

title: Add "Copy JSON" button to HTML report
body: since new JSON viewer is adding Unicode > and V characters for navigating the tree it is now impossible to copy and past JSON into some other tool. Please add a 'Copy JSON' button next to each JSON row which places the raw JSON code without Unicode into the Clipboard

Bests, Ali.

title: multi threading issue
body:
Hi,

1. There is an issue with the queues. When a request is dependent on another request, all queued requests will constantly check for the same variable in the temp events of the database. So we need to generate those requests after the variable is available and stop consuming the CPU.
2. if threads of one subprocess are finished, the subprocess will die. Maybe it's better to let the subprocesses help other subprocesses with their threads. 

Thanks, Ali.
author: Ali-Razmjoo

title: socket.py file name must be changed.
body:
[socket.py](https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/blob/master/core/module_protocols/socket.py) file name must be change to other name like `Socket.py` with capital 'S' or `SockeT.py` which should not conflict when some developers are making other python file in [module_protocol](https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/tree/master/core/module_protocols) folder which may use inbuild socket module in other python libraries. 

Your prompt response will be highly appreciated.

_________________
**OS**: `x`

**Python Version**: `x`

author: 1fc0nfig
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 1068269512, 'issue_id': 1169959037, 'author': '1fc0nfig', 'body': 'Okay, there was a problem with the library_name=DNS.
I've noticed that the actual name of package beeing imported is "DNS". I've then tried importing it using python console and there was an error.
I've uninstalled 'pythondns' and installed it again, as well as 'py3dns'.
Changed the "# library_name=DNS" to "# library_name=dns" and voila.
I am not sure if i solved it or if it will cause some problems later..', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 15, 17, 42, 16, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]
comment_thread:
1fc0nfig (Issue Creator) on (2022-03-15 17:42:16 UTC): Okay, there was a problem with the library_name=DNS.
I've noticed that the actual name of package beeing imported is "DNS". I've then tried importing it using python console and there was an error.
I've uninstalled 'pythondns' and installed it again, as well as 'py3dns'.
Changed the "# library_name=DNS" to "# library_name=dns" and voila.
I am not sure if i solved it or if it will cause some problems later..

title: Having nettacker in the PATH
body:
Right now the issue is that the installation directory is totally arbitrary and the install instructions doesn't prescribe to create a symlink in a directory that is accessible in the PATH. 

I'de propose to add the required steps in the installation docs such that Nettacker would be installed in `/opt/Nettacker/` and a symlink `/usr/local/bin/nettacker` is created. 

So the "Install Requirements" section would read as follows
```
git clone https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker.git /opt/
cd /opt/Nettacker/
apt-get update
apt-get install -y < requirements-apt-get.txt
pip3 install --upgrade pip
pip3 install -r requirements.txt
pip3 install -r requirements-dev.txt
ln -s /opt/Nettacker/nettacker.py /usr/local/bin/nettacker
```

With the note: This will install Nettacker under `/opt/Nettacker/` and create a symlink in `/usr/local/bin/`. Feel free to adjust this to your needs. 

#525 needs to merged for that to work.
author: tristanlatr

title: Contribute to Language Libraries
body:
Hey, I saw that in [en.yaml file](https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/blob/master/lib/messages/en.yaml) and [hi.yaml file](https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/blob/master/lib/messages/hi.yaml) some keywords/lines are missing.
I think we should modify it for better user experience.
One more thing, I guess Windows platform is no longer supported by Nettacker so we should remove the word ['Windows' in `error_platform` key](https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/blob/master/lib/messages/hi.yaml#L56).

@Ali-Razmjoo @securestep9 
 If you found this as a valid issue, then I would like to take up this issue for hi.yaml and en.yaml .

title: GDPR Privacy violation - IP addresses collected without consent
body:
This piece of code collects users' IP address which is qualified as personal data under EU GDPR:

https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/blob/54ec990e19ceb983d09c1f9f6365ac79a011d4be/core/compatible.py#L63

Users must **explicitly** give **consent** for collection of this personal data and the organisation (OWASP) shall be able **to demonstrate** that the data subject **has consented** to processing of his or her personal data.

Please note that the maximum penalty for GDPR violation can be up to 20 million euros:

https://gdpr-info.eu/issues/fines-penalties/
author: privacy-lawyer
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 918140450, 'issue_id': 994720730, 'author': 'Ali-Razmjoo', 'body': "Hi,

The configuration in [config.py](https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/blob/master/config.py#L138) disabled this feature. We decided not to gather any information because we couldn't figure out a good way to approach it and put them to good use. this part of the code that you mentioned [is disabled](https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/blob/54ec990e19ceb983d09c1f9f6365ac79a011d4be/core/compatible.py#L53-L67), and I can remove it since we don't use it not to raise any questions.

However, if we decide to gather any IP information in the feature, we will inform all users and take all necessary steps.

Bests, Ali.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 13, 12, 26, 11, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]
comment_thread:
Ali-Razmjoo on (2021-09-13 12:26:11 UTC): Hi,

The configuration in [config.py](https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/blob/master/config.py#L138) disabled this feature. We decided not to gather any information because we couldn't figure out a good way to approach it and put them to good use. this part of the code that you mentioned [is disabled](https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/blob/54ec990e19ceb983d09c1f9f6365ac79a011d4be/core/compatible.py#L53-L67), and I can remove it since we don't use it not to raise any questions.

However, if we decide to gather any IP information in the feature, we will inform all users and take all necessary steps.

Bests, Ali.

Ah, OK. I learned a lot from this tool, please do update it new architecture, I will be waiting for it!

I just have one more request, can you update the docker image to 0.0.2 as well? I'm not sure if it is the 0.0.2 version right now or not but I felt it was outdated cause it didn't worked on my machine. I tried creating my own docker image but was struggling and came to a dead end due to some version conflict in modules.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 23, 13, 41, 28, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 926112234, 'issue_id': 994453706, 'author': 'Ali-Razmjoo', 'body': "There is a `Dockerfile` in the directory of version 0.0.2. So all you need to do is download the v0.0.2 from [here](https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/tags) and then you have two to go forward:

1- build the image yourself.
```bash
docker build . -t nettacker
docker run --rm -p 5000:5000 -v $(pwd):/usr/src/owaspnettacker:Z  -it nettacker /bin/bash
python nettacker.py
```
2- use docker-compose
```
docker-compose up -d --build && docker exec -it nettacker_nettacker_1 /bin/bash
python nettacker.py
```
* notice, I used `--build` to make sure if there is an older version of the image, it will replace it, but once you build it, you can use `docker-compose up -d && docker exec -it nettacker_nettacker_1 /bin/bash` so you don't wait for the build.
* also, docker-compose expose port 5000. You can access it by opening it in the browser.
* to check if docker container is running use, `docker ps`
* to kill the background docker container, use `docker-compose down`


And I recommend before running scans, sync with the `master` branch with `git pull`. We update this project very frequently.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 23, 19, 59, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 926287284, 'issue_id': 994453706, 'author': 'murkeh217', 'body': '@Ali-Razmjoo 

Thank you so much! The explanation on usage of docker image was very helpful.

Understanding version changes and releases is quite important, haha', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 24, 2, 2, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 926485050, 'issue_id': 994453706, 'author': 'Ali-Razmjoo', 'body': 'please let me know if you have more feature requests, or questions. we will be more glad to help.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2021, 9, 24, 9, 30, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

Ali-Razmjoo on (2021-09-21 18:16:41 UTC): In the new version of nettacker, we changed some tables, which messed up the old version. Soon, we will migrate to elastic search, and Redis and I am unsure if we can continue supporting this due to the many limitations it causes us.

@securestep9 @itsdivyanshjain @aman566 any of you can work on a script maybe to migrate the old db to the new one?

murkeh217 (Issue Creator) on (2021-09-22 00:34:15 UTC): @Ali-Razmjoo What was the need for changing tables if migration wasn't initiated at all?

Ali-Razmjoo on (2021-09-23 10:58:27 UTC): I know it's an old project, but we are not even in beta, still in r&d phase and we don't think twice which is bad :D but so you know. you can keep using version 0.0.2, we just change the architecture in 0.0.3 and when it's a bit more clean code and bug-free we gonna go to next phase to add more stuff, then you might need to update...

murkeh217 (Issue Creator) on (2021-09-23 13:41:28 UTC): @Ali-Razmjoo 

Ah, OK. I learned a lot from this tool, please do update it new architecture, I will be waiting for it!

I just have one more request, can you update the docker image to 0.0.2 as well? I'm not sure if it is the 0.0.2 version right now or not but I felt it was outdated cause it didn't worked on my machine. I tried creating my own docker image but was struggling and came to a dead end due to some version conflict in modules.

Ali-Razmjoo on (2021-09-23 19:59:47 UTC): There is a `Dockerfile` in the directory of version 0.0.2. So all you need to do is download the v0.0.2 from [here](https://github.com/OWASP/Nettacker/tags) and then you have two to go forward:

1- build the image yourself.
```bash
docker build . -t nettacker
docker run --rm -p 5000:5000 -v $(pwd):/usr/src/owaspnettacker:Z  -it nettacker /bin/bash
python nettacker.py
```
2- use docker-compose
```
docker-compose up -d --build && docker exec -it nettacker_nettacker_1 /bin/bash
python nettacker.py
```
* notice, I used `--build` to make sure if there is an older version of the image, it will replace it, but once you build it, you can use `docker-compose up -d && docker exec -it nettacker_nettacker_1 /bin/bash` so you don't wait for the build.
* also, docker-compose expose port 5000. You can access it by opening it in the browser.
* to check if docker container is running use, `docker ps`
* to kill the background docker container, use `docker-compose down`


And I recommend before running scans, sync with the `master` branch with `git pull`. We update this project very frequently.

murkeh217 (Issue Creator) on (2021-09-24 02:02:42 UTC): @Ali-Razmjoo 

Thank you so much! The explanation on usage of docker image was very helpful.

Understanding version changes and releases is quite important, haha

Ali-Razmjoo on (2021-09-24 09:30:08 UTC): please let me know if you have more feature requests, or questions. we will be more glad to help.

title: Spanish language is missing 25 keys
body:
Spanish language isn't up-to-date. Some keys (25) are missing in Spanish in comparison to English (default language of this project). When I was adding the Brazilian Portuguese (a PR) I realized this issue.

**Keys missing**
`Invalid_whatcms_api_key`, `searching_whatcms_database`, `whatcms_monthly_quota_exceeded`, `Invalid_shodan_api_key`, `shodan_api_key`, `shodan_results_found`, `shodan_results_not_found`, `shodan_plan_upgrade`, `searching_shodan_database`, `graphql_inspection`, `graphql_inspection_console`, `graphql_console_not_found`, `API_cert`, `API_cert_key`, `api_cert`, `api_cert_key`, `wrong_values`, `using_shodan_query_override`, `invalid_database`, `database_connection_failed`, `fuzzer_no_response`, `summary_report`, `file_saved`, `no_event_found`, `invalid_json_type_to_db`

title: We need a module for MS Exchange CVE-2021-26855
body:
With MSExchange hacking still making headlines every day since 4th March 2021 the attacks are going on all over the world with tens of thousands servers hacked he need a CVE-2021-26855 vuln detection module to help organisations using OWASP Nettacker to detect if they have any vulnerable Exchange servers in their networks.

Nmap script can be found here:

https://github.com/microsoft/CSS-Exchange/blob/main/Security/src/http-vuln-cve2021-26855.nse

we need to create a nettacker module for this task: **msexchange_cve_2021_26855_vuln**
author: securestep9

title: Handle Exception
body:
We should use `except exception as e` instead of only `except exception`, otherwise it often difficult to debug the code. Like in issue #398 it shows module not exists because of import error in that module. This often deceiving and sometimes take bit of our time.
_________________
**OS**: `Backbox`

**OS Version**: `7.1`

**Python Version**: `3.8.5`
author: itsdivyanshjain
labels: [('code quality', 'Code Quality-related issue/PR no functional  changes')]
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 796442379, 'issue_id': 828713756, 'author': 'itsdivyanshjain', 'body': '@securestep9 If you found this as a valid issue, then I would like to take up this issue.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2021, 3, 11, 4, 32, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 800178235, 'issue_id': 828713756, 'author': 'securestep9', 'body': 'Hi @itsdivyanshjain , yes, it is a valid point to improve code quality.  Please do check and review PR #403 first - DeepSource tool was used to analyse the code to find few other code quality issues', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2021, 3, 16, 11, 26, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 800205827, 'issue_id': 828713756, 'author': 'itsdivyanshjain', 'body': 'Sure @securestep9 . I will do that', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2021, 3, 16, 12, 9, 7, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 888016147, 'issue_id': 828713756, 'author': 'Rohan-Salwan', 'body': 'Hi @itsdivyanshjain
Actually Nettacker tool has its own default set of messsages for any exception case so you want to replace this message with exception and traceback detailes. plz share your thoughts on this and guide me.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2021, 7, 28, 5, 13, 32, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 888275176, 'issue_id': 828713756, 'author': 'itsdivyanshjain', 'body': "Hey @Rohan-Salwan, 

Nettacker does have set of messages, but when it breaks it goes for an exception and print the particular line from a set of messages which may be deceptive. In case of issue #398 it's showing `module port_scan is not available` and while debugging we get to know about an issue which is `importerror` in port_scan module. So, here clearly we didn't handle exception clearly well. Remember using `exception as e` is not a solution as well, the important thing is to improve exception handling.

P.s: currently Nettacker going from lot of changes because of that you should wait for changes to merge then send PR if you want any improvement.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2021, 7, 28, 12, 39, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

itsdivyanshjain (Issue Creator) on (2021-03-11 04:32:59 UTC): @securestep9 If you found this as a valid issue, then I would like to take up this issue.

securestep9 on (2021-03-16 11:26:56 UTC): Hi @itsdivyanshjain , yes, it is a valid point to improve code quality.  Please do check and review PR #403 first - DeepSource tool was used to analyse the code to find few other code quality issues

itsdivyanshjain (Issue Creator) on (2021-03-16 12:09:07 UTC): Sure @securestep9 . I will do that

Rohan-Salwan on (2021-07-28 05:13:32 UTC): Hi @itsdivyanshjain
Actually Nettacker tool has its own default set of messsages for any exception case so you want to replace this message with exception and traceback detailes. plz share your thoughts on this and guide me.

itsdivyanshjain (Issue Creator) on (2021-07-28 12:39:45 UTC): Hey @Rohan-Salwan, 

Nettacker does have set of messages, but when it breaks it goes for an exception and print the particular line from a set of messages which may be deceptive. In case of issue #398 it's showing `module port_scan is not available` and while debugging we get to know about an issue which is `importerror` in port_scan module. So, here clearly we didn't handle exception clearly well. Remember using `exception as e` is not a solution as well, the important thing is to improve exception handling.

P.s: currently Nettacker going from lot of changes because of that you should wait for changes to merge then send PR if you want any improvement.

Regarding Scapy, In Mac python3.9.2 after installing scapy, I am able to get results But getting the error after getting the results: `AttributeError: 'L3bpfSocket' object has no attribute 'ins' if not self.closed and self.ins is not None: AttributeError: 'L3bpfSocket' object has no attribute 'ins'` ', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2021, 3, 9, 6, 43, 34, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 793770539, 'issue_id': 825195150, 'author': 'itsdivyanshjain', 'body': 'we should wait for pycurl support for python 3.9 In regards to scapy, it showing different error to different OS, also i have now tried running python 3.9.2 in docker containers it works completely fine(scapy need to install).', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2021, 3, 9, 11, 47, 43, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 793773497, 'issue_id': 825195150, 'author': 'aman566', 'body': 'Yes you are right', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2021, 3, 9, 11, 50, 27, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 808905923, 'issue_id': 825195150, 'author': 'Rohan-Salwan', 'body': 'Same issue in python 3.8.5', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2021, 3, 28, 14, 39, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 809055584, 'issue_id': 825195150, 'author': 'itsdivyanshjain', 'body': "@Rohan-Salwan @securestep9 yes, this `port_scan` module affecting python version 3.8.5 (all python3 versions) now, but by merging this PR#400 this issue can be solved(i have tested out this on docker ubuntu image too and it's work fine). Also, PR #400 doesn't solve the issue for python>3.9.1.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2021, 3, 29, 4, 24, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]
comment_thread: itsdivyanshjain on (2021-03-09 03:41:27 UTC): I would like to take up this issue aman566 on (2021-03-09 04:24:40 UTC): In python 3.9.0 It's working fine after installing scapy properly. `[X] this module "port_scan" is not available.` is due to scapy itsdivyanshjain on (2021-03-09 06:21:55 UTC): Hey @aman566 , this fix works only for python 3.9.0 not for 3.9.1 and 3.9.2, its show error `[Errno 2] No such file or directory: b'liblibc.a`(after installing scapy module). https://stackoverflow.com/questions/65410481/filenotfounderror-errno-2-no-such-file-or-directory-bliblibc-a Above link mentioned temporary solution regarding this, also pycurl is having similar issues in windows, it work well for python 3.8 but not for python_version > 3.9. I think we should wait for official library support for python_version>3.9 until then we should support now only till < python 3.9. aman566 on (2021-03-09 06:43:34 UTC): Hello @itsdivyanshjain .Yes, pycurl is having issues in Ubuntu(linux) too. Regarding Scapy, In Mac python3.9.2 after installing scapy, I am able to get results But getting the error after getting the results: `AttributeError: 'L3bpfSocket' object has no attribute 'ins' if not self.closed and self.ins is not None: AttributeError: 'L3bpfSocket' object has no attribute 'ins'` itsdivyanshjain on (2021-03-09 11:47:43 UTC): we should wait for pycurl support for python 3.9 In regards to scapy, it showing different error to different OS, also i have now tried running python 3.9.2 in docker containers it works completely fine(scapy need to install). aman566 on (2021-03-09 11:50:27 UTC): Yes you are right Rohan-Salwan on (2021-03-28 14:39:29 UTC): Same issue in python 3.8.5 itsdivyanshjain on (2021-03-29 04:24:14 UTC): @Rohan-Salwan @securestep9 yes, this `port_scan` module affecting python version 3.8.5 (all python3 versions) now, but by merging this PR#400 this issue can be solved(i have tested out this on docker ubuntu image too and it's work fine). Also, PR #400 doesn't solve the issue for python>3.9.1.

title: Improvement in csp_vuln mdule
body:
Currently, the content_security_policy module only checks for presence for the `Content-Security-Policy` header. However, we should also check for the `<meta http-equiv="Content-Security-Policy"`  tag in the absence of the CSP header.
Moreover, we could also check for the `unsafe-inline` and `unsafe-eval` directives as to the weak implementation of CSP

title: wp_plugin_scan module not reporting results / reporting false-positives due to 403
body:
Please describe the issue or question and share your OS and Python version.
_________________
**OS**: `MacOS`

**OS Version**: `Catalina`

**Python Version**: `3.6`


wp_plugin_scan relied on being able to get the directory listing from the plugins folder which is no longer true for modern versions of WordPress. As a result the module returns lots of false positives when 403 is returned or no detection at all.

Checking for a presence of readme.txt in a plugin folder is a more reliable detection

title: smtp brute tls issue
body:
I noticed we used `starttls()` for smtp brute, it won't work on normal smtp unless tls is enabled. 

https://github.com/zdresearch/OWASP-Nettacker/blob/master/lib/brute/smtp/engine.py#L62
https://github.com/zdresearch/OWASP-Nettacker/blob/master/lib/brute/smtp/engine.py#L122

we can remove these to lines and have another module (smtps_brute) instead for smtp+tls/ssl or maybe we can add a condition to detect if it should use tls or not?
author: Ali-Razmjoo

title: Tool running Wordpress Modules on a domain which does not support Wordpress
body:
If a website is made over WordPress then only it should check for wp-user-enum, wp-plugins, wp-themes.
Websites that are not built on WordPress, the tool should skip those checks.

It will affect and time will be wasted if we use **-s** for scanning all subdomains because in that case WordPress modules will be checked on all subdomains and not every subdomain will be made on WordPress in normal cases.

The tool should first check the cms it is using by calling wappalyzer or whatcms modules and then detect if any WordPress cms is present or not. If it has cms then it should go for WordPress modules, else should skip that subdomain for WordPress checks.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32503192/86726448-3229cd00-c048-11ea-8aeb-72431ef15eca.png)


_________________
**OS**: `Linux`

**OS Version**: `Ubuntu 18.04`

**Python Version**: `3.6.9`
author: aman566
comments_list: [{'comment_id': 676781864, 'issue_id': 652037649, 'author': 'securestep9', 'body': '@aman566 - this is a good feature request suggestion, however with less priority. I would expect that the users will run CMS-specific scans (WordPress/Joomla/Drupal) only after confirming the actual CMS using cms_detection_scan module, wappalyser or whatcms (for Internet-facing sites) for now. We can (and we definitely should) implement this, but a bit later', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 19, 22, 34, 28, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 676810418, 'issue_id': 652037649, 'author': 'aman566', 'body': 'Yes sure.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 19, 23, 32, 3, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

title: Bug(Recursion) in calling warn, error from api
body:
This is actually an interesting recursive logic where we are not allowed to call warn, error functions when using API but the __die_failure() uses error. When calling the error function, it says that if the command contains "--start-api" then it won't print a thing. Interesting one. I will soon fix it.

title: False Positives while running dir_scan
body:
The current version of Nettacker scans for directory listing. But doing directory listing it searches for 401, 403, 200 status codes which is really a good approach. But in this manner what happens is many websites(90% where I used the tool) smartly creates some 404 pages where the status codes are 200 which is really bad for the tool giving false positives.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32503192/83360601-1162bd80-a3a0-11ea-8ea2-3c45b8a3b515.png)

_________________
**OS**: `Linux`

**OS Version**: `Ubuntu 18.04`

**Python Version**: `3.6.9`
author: aman566
comments_list: [{'comment_id': 713628492, 'issue_id': 628023991, 'author': '0xrishabh', 'body': "I don't think there's any way to deal with this situation, other than to use `ffuf` which gives you the option to auto-calibrate false positive and removes them.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2020, 10, 21, 14, 43, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 761802551, 'issue_id': 628023991, 'author': 'itsdivyanshjain', 'body': 'We can reduce the false positive by checking the title and meta tags of html files which contains keywords like 404,not found, etc... As most html returned 404 pages with status 200 follows the same pattern. This may reduce false positive in a significant manner.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2021, 1, 17, 12, 15, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]
comment_thread:
0xrishabh on (2020-10-21 14:43:19 UTC): I don't think there's any way to deal with this situation, other than to use `ffuf` which gives you the option to auto-calibrate false positive and removes them.

itsdivyanshjain on (2021-01-17 12:15:31 UTC): We can reduce the false positive by checking the title and meta tags of html files which contains keywords like 404,not found, etc... As most html returned 404 pages with status 200 follows the same pattern. This may reduce false positive in a significant manner.

title: Error running maltego transforms
body:
The steps give in maltego usage in the documentation is followed but the command:
`canari create-profile nettacker_transforms -w {ABSOLUTE PATH OF DIRECTORY}/OWASP-Nettacker/lib/transactions/maltego/nettacker_transforms/src`

Giving this error:
```
Loading Canari configuration file '/home/am4n/.canari/canari.conf'
Usage: canari create-profile [OPTIONS] [PACKAGE]
Try 'canari create-profile --help' for help.
```
This is my .canari/canari.conf file:
```
[canari.local]
# Additional config files that should be read to merge with the current config
configs =

path = ${PATH},/usr/local/bin,/opt/local/bin

[canari.remote]
# This section deals exclusively with remote transform execution and has no effect on local transform execution. Modify
# these options if you are running your transforms under plume.

# Additional config files that should be read to merge with the current config in remote exec mode.
configs =

# Specify any transforms that your WSGI container will host. This is for Plume ONLY.
packages =

path = ${PATH},/usr/local/bin,/opt/local/bin
```
Something is going wrong with my canari.conf file I think. This issue will come whenever someone freshly clone the repo and follow the [maltego transforms](https://github.com/zdresearch/OWASP-Nettacker/wiki/Usage#maltego-transforms)
_________________
**OS**: `Linux`

**OS Version**: `Ubuntu 18.04`

**Python Version**: `3.6.9`

title: [Low] Unmet dependencies in requirements.txt
body:
There are some unmet dependencies in the `requirements.txt`:
- The module under `brute/http_ntlm` uses the `pycurl` library.
- The module under `payload/scanner/ics_honeypot` uses the `xmltodict` library.

Both of which are not marked as dependencies in the `requirements.txt`.
_________________
**OS**: `Ubuntu`

**OS Version**: `18.04`

**Python Version**: `3.6`
author: 0xInfection

title: [Medium] Issues within kippo_honeypot module
body:
The module `kippo_honeypot` detector has the following bugs:
- Uses quite a number of `socks` functions, eg. `socks.socksocket`, `sock.SOCKS4` without importing it. 
- Uses `getaddrinfo()` function from `lib.socks_resolver.engine` library without importing it.
- Includes the following code on Line 48:
    ```
        if s is not None:
            banner = recv_all(s)
            s.send(banner + spacer)
            response = recv_all(s)
    ```
    where the variable spacer has not been declared.

Fixed by: #243
_________________
**OS**: `Ubuntu`

**OS Version**: `18.04`

**Python Version**: `3.6`
author: 0xInfection

title: Set-Cookie header related Vulnerabilities
body:
The set-cookie header has some flags like secure, httponly, samesite. If these flags are not enable then it can help attacker to exploit the site in various ways. But if samesite cookie is enabled then the website is safe from CSRF attacks. Ex In this blog: https://www.acunetix.com/blog/articles/chrome-tightens-csrf-protection/ after adding samesite cookie which will prevent the csrf attacks. I will add a module for searching for these flags in Set-Cookie header which will in return gives whether the application is vulnerable or not.
_________________
**OS**: `Linux`

**OS Version**: `Ubuntu`

**Python Version**: `3.6.9`
author: aman566

title: [Medium] Multiple logical bugs within header_xss module
body:
The `header_xss` module, contains the following on line 34:
```
        r = requests.head(host)
        for header in r.headers:
            headers_xss[header] = payloads_xss
        req = requests.post(host, headers=headers_xss)
        if payloads_xss.lower() in req.text.lower():
            return True
        else:
            return False
```
So what the engine does is, it makes a HEAD request to the site, and then it iterates over the received headers from the HEAD request and adds them to the already existing `headers_xss` dictionary. By doing this we are actually violating the w3 standards defined in RFC 7230-7235. 

A quick glance at the [wikipedia page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_HTTP_header_fields#Request_fields) says a lot about the specific set of header fields which can be used during a client request. But, when we are appending the set of response header fields, to the request header set, we are defying the standard.

Elaborately explaining, taking the following example:
- Site: http://www.webscantest.com
- Making the HEAD request, yeilds the following headers:
```
{
'Date': 'Wed, 25 Mar 2020 06:05:32 GMT', 
'Server': 'Apache/2.4.7 (Ubuntu)', 
'X-Powered-By': 'PHP/5.5.9-1ubuntu4.29', 
'Set-Cookie': 'TEST_SESSIONID=ak6b8793njuaai9lns68ka9q54; path=/, NB_SRVID=srv140717; path=/', 
'Expires': 'Thu, 19 Nov 1981 08:52:00 GMT', 
'Cache-Control': 'no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate, post-check=0, pre-check=0', 
'Pragma': 'no-cache', 
'Connection': 'close', 
'Content-Type': 'text/html'
}
```
- Performing the dict transformation: `for header in r.headers: headers_xss[header] = payloads_xss`, the header set we get is:
```
{
'User-Agent': '<script>alert()</script>', 
'Except': '<script>alert()</script>',
'Accept-Encoding': '<script>alert()</script>', 
'Referer': '<script>alert()</script>', 
'Accept-Language': '<script>alert()</script>', 
'Date': '<script>alert()</script>', 
'Server': '<script>alert()</script>', 
'X-Powered-By': '<script>alert()</script>', 
'Set-Cookie': '<script>alert()</script>', 
'Expires': '<script>alert()</script>', 
'Cache-Control': '<script>alert()</script>', 
'Pragma': '<script>alert()</script>', 
'Connection': '<script>alert()</script>', 
'Content-Type': '<script>alert()</script>'
}
```
Now if we are performing the POST request using this set of headers, we are violating the client-server model, since we are both using the header set of a server as well as the browser/client lol.

Also, I see we are making a POST request without any data?

Also, the `payloads_xss` value is set to `<script>alert(/1/)</script>` which is a HTML context payload. I think we should support javascript context based payloads as well as reflected input based contexts too, since we are never sure how and where the input is getting reflected/stored!

I maybe wrong in my understanding hence ccing @pradeepjairamani, the author of the code. He might have other intentions while writing the code, hence I'm open to a quality discussion. :)
author: 0xInfection

title: [Low] Circular Dependency Import Issue
body:
There is an import-based circular dependency/variable name collision between the files `core/attack.py` and `core/compatible.py`.

The file `core/compatible.py` contains the following on line 6:
```
from core.alert import *
```
And the code in `core/alert.py` contains the following on line 8:
```
from core.compatible import version
```
So as you clearly see there is a circular import which is causing variable name collisions between the 2 files.

Issue fixed by: #238
_________________
**OS**: `Ubuntu`

**OS Version**: `18.04`

**Python Version**: `3.6`
author: 0xInfection

[{'comment_id': 602217904, 'issue_id': 585523475, 'author': 'zaunist', 'body': 'The file core/compatible.py contains the following on line 27:
` from core.alert import write_to_api_console`
Circular import in Python can be avoided by introducing them into functions, but this is cure the symptoms, not the disease。', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 22, 14, 38, 58, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 602374912, 'issue_id': 585523475, 'author': '0xInfection', 'body': "Hey @beyondexp,

I think you are mistaken somewhere. If you look at the [changes proposed](https://github.com/zdresearch/OWASP-Nettacker/pull/238/files) via #238, you'll see I removed all dependents from `core/alert.py`. The only logic here was that `core/compatible.py` may depend on `core/alert.py` but the reverse should not be true, i.e. `core/alert.py` shouldn't depend on `core/compatible.py` since it itself is a top level import.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 23, 4, 11, 53, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 602386154, 'issue_id': 585523475, 'author': 'zaunist', 'body': "Sorry i didn't see your this commit [0c62662](https://github.com/zdresearch/OWASP-Nettacker/pull/238/commits/0c626625bcbf5f48fcee3c042f133fb26fec94ac)", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2020, 3, 23, 4, 59, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

Circular import in Python can be avoided by introducing them into functions, but this is cure the symptoms, not the disease。

0xInfection (Issue Creator) on (2020-03-23 04:11:53 UTC): Hey @beyondexp,

I think you are mistaken somewhere. If you look at the [changes proposed](https://github.com/zdresearch/OWASP-Nettacker/pull/238/files) via #238, you'll see I removed all dependents from `core/alert.py`. The only logic here was that `core/compatible.py` may depend on `core/alert.py` but the reverse should not be true, i.e. `core/alert.py` shouldn't depend on `core/compatible.py` since it itself is a top level import.
