title: slow calculation in graphs
author: Ali-Razmjoo
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 363023588, 'issue_id': 294124971, 'author': 'avhvr-zz', 'body': "Hello,
I'd like to work on this. Can you help me with an approach?", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2018, 2, 5, 9, 12, 55, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 363083729, 'issue_id': 294124971, 'author': 'Ali-Razmjoo', 'body': 'Hey,

you can see the information is passing to the [start() function](https://github.com/viraintel/OWASP-Nettacker/blob/master/lib/graph/d3_tree_v1/engine.py#L10).

```python
def start(graph_flag, language, data, _HOST, _USERNAME, _PASSWORD, _PORT, _TYPE, _DESCRIPTION)
```
the `data` is generated JSON data from the framework, and it has to be changed to the graph structure. OWASP Nettacker JSON data starts with an array, and then events.

```
# owasp nettacker
[
  {
    "USERNAME": "",
    "CATEGORY": "scan",
    "SCAN_ID": "09561c27ba0220ed95fe872801c63002",
    "DESCRIPTION": "OPEN PORT",
    "SCAN_CMD": "nettacker.py -i 127.0.0.1 -m all -t 1000 -u root -p root -o ff.json --exclude viewdns_reverse_ip_lookup_scan",
    "HOST": "127.0.0.1",
    "TIME": "2018-02-03 20:00:45",
    "PASSWORD": "",
    "TYPE": "tcp_connect_port_scan",
    "PORT": 22
  }
]
```
but d3 starts with a key `name` and an array `children`, for each `HOST` in OWASP Nettacker event, you need to create a new data in `children` array, and set the `name` equal to `HOST`.

```
{
  "name": "Started Attack",
  "children": [
    {
      "name": "127.0.0.1",
      "children": []
     },
     {
      "name": "192.168.1.2",
      "children": []
     }
  ]
}
```

after that, every `HOST` has an array `children` too and it needs to be filled with events information. in this section, the name is `TYPE` in OWASP Nettacker event (scan_method name). and also name has `children` and it has a name again filled with information with `HOST`, `PORT`, `DESCRIPTION`, `USERNAME`, `PASSWORD`.

```
{
  "name": "Started Attack",
  "children": [
    {
      "name": "127.0.0.1",
      "children": [
         "name": "tcp_connect_port_scan",
          "children": [
            {
              "name": "HOST: 127.0.0.1 PORT: \"22\" DESCRIPTION: \"OPEN PORT\" USERNAME: \"\" PASSWORD: \"\""
            }
      ]
     },
     {
      "name": "192.168.1.2",
      "children": [
            {
              "name": "HOST: 127.0.0.1 PORT: \"22\" DESCRIPTION: \"OPEN PORT\" USERNAME: \"\" PASSWORD: \"\""
            }
         ]
     }
  ]
}
```

You need to do JIT in its structure way too.

Regards', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2018, 2, 5, 13, 26, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 363232448, 'issue_id': 294124971, 'author': 'avhvr-zz', 'body': "I didn't find any results/result folder after a scan is completed where the scan details are generated to HTML files as usual ? Do you also have the same problem @Ali-Razmjoo ? It is also showing that I'm not using the latest version even I/m using the latest one. Can you check and confirm?

harsha@CYBERSAPIEN10:~/github/OWASP-Nettacker$ python3 nettacker.py -i exploringthing.com -m all                    


    
   ______          __      _____ _____  
  / __ \ \        / /\    / ____|  __ \ 
 | |  | \ \  /\  / /  \  | (___ | |__) |
 | |  | |\ \/  \/ / /\ \  \___ \|  ___/ 
 | |__| | \  /\  / ____ \ ____) | |     Version 0.0.1  
  \____/   \/  \/_/    \_\_____/|_|     SAME
                          _   _      _   _             _            
                         | \ | |    | | | |           | |            
  github.com/viraintel   |  \| | ___| |_| |_ __ _  ___| | _____ _ __ 
  owasp.org              | . ` |/ _ \ __| __/ _` |/ __| |/ / _ \ '__|
  viraintel.com          | |\  |  __/ |_| || (_| | (__|   <  __/ |   
                         |_| \_|\___|\__|\__\__,_|\___|_|\_\___|_|   
                                               
    

[+] Nettacker engine started ...


**[!] you are not using the last version of OWASP Nettacker, please update.**
[+] 13 modules loaded ...
[+] target exploringthing.com submitted!

sorry, I didn't update documents yet! in the last version results folder moved to `~/.owasp-nettacker/results`. it's equal to `C:\Users\user\.owasp-nettacker\results`, `/home/user/.owasp-nettacker/results` ...

that last version error would be fixed after our first release, please ignore that!.

if you want to change the output file, use `-o file.html`, `-o file.txt`, `-o file.json`.

Regards.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2018, 2, 5, 23, 34, 48, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 364662304, 'issue_id': 294124971, 'author': 'avhvr-zz', 'body': 'Hello,

I have an easier way to convert the **data** into **d3** json structure 

```
# creating a normalised_json
normalisedjson = {
	"name": "Started attack",
	"children": {}
	}

for each_scan in data:

	if each_scan['HOST'] not in normalisedjson['children']:
		normalisedjson['children'].update({each_scan['HOST']:{}})
		normalisedjson['children'][each_scan['HOST']].update({each_scan['TYPE']:[]})

	if each_scan['TYPE'] not in normalisedjson['children'][each_scan['HOST']]:
		normalisedjson['children'][each_scan['HOST']].update({each_scan['TYPE']:[]})

	normalisedjson['children'][each_scan['HOST']][each_scan['TYPE']].append("HOST:%s, PORT:\"%s\", DESCRIPTION:\"%s\",  USERNAME:\"%s\",  PASSWORD:\"%s\""
		% (each_scan['HOST'], each_scan['PORT'], each_scan['DESCRIPTION'], each_scan['USERNAME'], each_scan['PASSWORD']))


# creating a d3_json
d3 = {"name": "Starting attack",
	 "children": []}

for host in list(normalisedjson['children'].keys()):
	d3["children"].append({"name": host, "children": [
		{"name":otype, "children": [
		{"name": description} for description in normalisedjson['children'][host][otype]]} for otype in list(normalisedjson['children'][host].keys()) ]})
```

avhvr-zz on (2018-02-05 09:12:55 UTC): Hello,
I'd like to work on this. Can you help me with an approach?

Ali-Razmjoo (Issue Creator) on (2018-02-05 13:26:02 UTC): Hey,

you can see the information is passing to the [start() function](https://github.com/viraintel/OWASP-Nettacker/blob/master/lib/graph/d3_tree_v1/engine.py#L10).

```python
def start(graph_flag, language, data, _HOST, _USERNAME, _PASSWORD, _PORT, _TYPE, _DESCRIPTION)
```
the `data` is generated JSON data from the framework, and it has to be changed to the graph structure. OWASP Nettacker JSON data starts with an array, and then events.

```
# owasp nettacker
[
  {
    "USERNAME": "",
    "CATEGORY": "scan",
    "SCAN_ID": "09561c27ba0220ed95fe872801c63002",
    "DESCRIPTION": "OPEN PORT",
    "SCAN_CMD": "nettacker.py -i 127.0.0.1 -m all -t 1000 -u root -p root -o ff.json --exclude viewdns_reverse_ip_lookup_scan",
    "HOST": "127.0.0.1",
    "TIME": "2018-02-03 20:00:45",
    "PASSWORD": "",
    "TYPE": "tcp_connect_port_scan",
    "PORT": 22
  }
]
```
but d3 starts with a key `name` and an array `children`, for each `HOST` in OWASP Nettacker event, you need to create a new data in `children` array, and set the `name` equal to `HOST`.

```
{
  "name": "Started Attack",
  "children": [
    {
      "name": "127.0.0.1",
      "children": []
     },
     {
      "name": "192.168.1.2",
      "children": []
     }
  ]
}
```

after that, every `HOST` has an array `children` too and it needs to be filled with events information. in this section, the name is `TYPE` in OWASP Nettacker event (scan_method name). and also name has `children` and it has a name again filled with information with `HOST`, `PORT`, `DESCRIPTION`, `USERNAME`, `PASSWORD`.

```
{
  "name": "Started Attack",
  "children": [
    {
      "name": "127.0.0.1",
      "children": [
         "name": "tcp_connect_port_scan",
          "children": [
            {
              "name": "HOST: 127.0.0.1 PORT: \"22\" DESCRIPTION: \"OPEN PORT\" USERNAME: \"\" PASSWORD: \"\""
            }
      ]
     },
     {
      "name": "192.168.1.2",
      "children": [
            {
              "name": "HOST: 127.0.0.1 PORT: \"22\" DESCRIPTION: \"OPEN PORT\" USERNAME: \"\" PASSWORD: \"\""
            }
         ]
     }
  ]
}
```

You need to do JIT in its structure way too.

Regards

avhvr-zz on (2018-02-10 15:21:31 UTC): Hello,

I have an easier way to convert the **data** into **d3** json structure 

```
# creating a normalised_json
normalisedjson = {
	"name": "Started attack",
	"children": {}
	}

for each_scan in data:

	if each_scan['HOST'] not in normalisedjson['children']:
		normalisedjson['children'].update({each_scan['HOST']:{}})
		normalisedjson['children'][each_scan['HOST']].update({each_scan['TYPE']:[]})

	if each_scan['TYPE'] not in normalisedjson['children'][each_scan['HOST']]:
		normalisedjson['children'][each_scan['HOST']].update({each_scan['TYPE']:[]})

	normalisedjson['children'][each_scan['HOST']][each_scan['TYPE']].append("HOST:%s, PORT:\"%s\", DESCRIPTION:\"%s\",  USERNAME:\"%s\",  PASSWORD:\"%s\""
		% (each_scan['HOST'], each_scan['PORT'], each_scan['DESCRIPTION'], each_scan['USERNAME'], each_scan['PASSWORD']))


# creating a d3_json
d3 = {"name": "Starting attack",
	 "children": []}

for host in list(normalisedjson['children'].keys()):
	d3["children"].append({"name": host, "children": [
		{"name":otype, "children": [
		{"name": description} for description in normalisedjson['children'][host][otype]]} for otype in list(normalisedjson['children'][host].keys()) ]})

```
I'll also do it for **jit** json structure.

title: Problem in run from other Directories
body: Hello everyone, While running this framework on my machine (in MacOS) I've been notice that there is a different between running from "Working Directory" and from other Directories. I think its because the framework can't read (find) its own files when "Working Directory" & "Location of Framework" are different; and when framework run from directories which are NOT the working directory, it can't find its own files and causes this problem. Let me know if anyone have idea about that. Regards. _________________ **OS**: `MacOS` **OS Version**: `MacOS Sierra` **Python Version**: `2.7.10`

title: prevent collision while writing logs
body:
Hello everyone,

While I was testing the frameworks, I notice that sometimes when the modules are writing the logs some collision happens.

```python
save = open(log_in_file, 'a')
save.write(
    json.dumps({'HOST': target, 'USERNAME': user, 'PASSWORD': passwd, 'PORT': port, 'TYPE': 'ssh_brute',
                'DESCRIPTION': messages(language, 66), 'TIME': now(), 'CATEGORY': "brute",
                'SCAN_ID': scan_id, 'SCAN_CMD': scan_cmd}) + '\n')
save.close()
```

it's best to add a function to the core and use it for locking the file and waiting for unlocking and replace all logging with this function.

sample function:
```python
def __log_to_file(filename, mode="a")
	while 1:
		if file not lock:
			lock the file
			write.filename.mode
			unlock the file
			break
		else 
			sleep x.x
	return True
```

Let me know if anyone can help with this.

Regards.
author: Ali-Razmjoo
labels: [('bug', None), ('enhancement', None), ('help wanted', None), ('done', None), ('priority', None)]

you have to create a function in `core/log.py`, inputs must be the filename, file writing mode (append[`a`], append-byte[`ab`], write[`w`], write-byte[`wb`]), content.

after getting the inputs you must check if the file is lock wait, and if it's not you may lock it (to prevent other processes open it) and write the content.

after that, each write functions should be fixed in the modules, e.g.: tcp_connect_port_scan module [line 128](https://github.com/viraintel/OWASP-Nettacker/blob/master/lib/scan/tcp_connect_port/engine.py#L128)

title: IPv6 Support for OWASP Nettacker Framework
body:
Hello everyone,

Currently the framework supports 5 types of target input. `IPv6`, `RANGE_IPv4`,  `CIDR_IPv4`, `DOMAIN`, `HTTP`.

```
IPv4: 127.0.0.1
RANGE_IPv4: 127.0.0.1-128.255.255.255
CIDR_IPv4: 127.0.0.1/8
Domain: owasp.org
```
The biggest missing feature is support `IPv6`.  I glad if anyone can help to improve the framework to support `IPv6`, `RANGE_IPv6` and `CIDR_IPv6`.  target types are defined in `core/targets.py`.

let me know if you have any question,

Regards.
author: Ali-Razmjoo

title: Implement a subdomain scanner
body:
Hello everyone,

The framework subdomain scanner (`-s`, `--sub-domains` switch) is using [sublist3r](https://github.com/aboul3la/Sublist3r). we will need to add a `subdomain_scan` in our module in future BTW it would be great if we could remove this tool from `lib/sublist3r` and replace it with our own subdomain scanner. or if anyone has a better idea?

if you look into `core/targets.py`, you will see these codes.
```python
                    tmp_exec = os.popen(
                        'python lib/sublist3r/sublist3r.py -d {0} -o {1} '.format(target, subs_temp)).read()
                    tmp_exec = list(set(open(subs_temp, 'r').read().replace(' ', '').rsplit()))
```
the problem is, sometimes this tool is too slow!

let me know if you have any question.

Regards.

title: A better target calculation
body:
Hello everyone,

When the framework starts, It starts processing on targets and calculate the number of them. (getting subdomains, IP ranges and etc). this process is in the `core/parse.py` by calling the `analysis` function from `core/targets.py`.

`core/parse.py`:

```python
    for total_targets, _ in enumerate(
            analysis(targets, check_ranges, check_subdomains, subs_temp, range_temp, log_in_file, time_sleep,
                     language, verbose_level, show_version, check_update, socks_proxy, retries)):
        pass
    total_targets += 1
    total_targets = total_targets * len(scan_method)
    targets = analysis(targets, check_ranges, check_subdomains, subs_temp, range_temp, log_in_file, time_sleep,
                       language, verbose_level, show_version, check_update, socks_proxy, retries)
```

as you see, first it's calculating the `total_targets` and then it's recalling the function **again** to get the targets.

I know it's wrong but It's working! I glad if someone provides a better method!

let me know if you have any question.

Regards.

title: Add category to events
body:
Hello everyone,

There are 6 keys in the event. which are:

```json
{
  "USERNAME": "",
  "DESCRIPTION": "OPEN PORT",
  "HOST": "127.0.0.1",
  "TIME": "2018-01-11 08:03:34",
  "PASSWORD": "",
  "TYPE": "tcp_connect_port_scan",
  "PORT": 1080
}
```

It would be better if we add `CATEGORY` in the event. to do this, you need to add it to all available modules in `lib/scan` and `lib/brute`.

note: please update the #4 after the task finished.

Let me know if there is any question.
Regards.
author: Ali-Razmjoo

title: Select modules for scanning by using the category
body:
Hello everyone,

Right now we can select the modules with `-m` switch and it works like:
```
-m tcp_connect_port_scan
-m tcp_connect_port_scan,smtp_brute
-m tcp_connect_port_scan,ssh_brute,dir_scan
-m all
```
but it does not support the `*_scan` or `*_brute` or in future `*_vuln` (`*_x`). It's best to add the `*` pattern.

Just notice that, if anyone select anything, we must check if its not returning empty! (`*_blabla`) will return nothing!

you can develop it by adding a custom rule in `check_all_required`  in `load_all_args` function. this part:

```python
....
    if scan_method is not None and scan_method == "all":
        scan_method = module_names
        scan_method.remove("all")
...
```

let me know if there is any question.

Regards.
author: Ali-Razmjoo

* a few more brute force modules (http (basic auth, ntlm, form), telnet, and so on)

title: Create more categories for the framework
body:
Hello everyone,

The framework already has `scan` and `brute` category. It's best if we can add more categories like `vuln` to check the vulnerabilities and exploits or `fuzz` to create some fuzzer or something! (I don't have ideas for fuzzers).

for the beginning, `heartbleed_vuln` or `ethernal_blue_vuln` would be great!

let me know if there is any question.
Regards.

title: A better language library
body:
Hello everyone,

As you see the framework is growing, we may need a better language library to keep our data in and also easier to develop for developers and translators. right now we keeping the language's data in the `core/languages.py` but I believe it needs to be separate and get a new face. I suggest `XML` or `JSON` structure. And it's better if every module has their own language library file.

Let me know if there is any question.

Regards.
author: Ali-Razmjoo
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 357163705, 'issue_id': 287671318, 'author': 'Ali-Razmjoo', 'body': "Hi,

XML libraries are more handy for users but it's used many resources to read and parse them. so it's best to use JSON inside of python until we get a better solution. Documents must be updated in wiki #1 too.

Regards.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2018, 1, 12, 7, 31, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]
comment_thread:
Ali-Razmjoo (Issue Creator) on (2018-01-12 07:31:59 UTC): Hi,

XML libraries are more handy for users but it's used many resources to read and parse them. so it's best to use JSON inside of python until we get a better solution. Documents must be updated in wiki #1 too.

Regards.

title: A better multi threaded framework!
author: Ali-Razmjoo
labels: [('enhancement', None), ('priority', None), ('Version 0.0.3', 'Must be done for releasing Nettacker v0.0.3')]
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 357277394, 'issue_id': 287670173, 'author': 'Ali-Razmjoo', 'body': "Hello,

It's better now! (almost fixed)

Regards.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2018, 1, 12, 15, 59, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 363766526, 'issue_id': 287670173, 'author': 'Ali-Razmjoo', 'body': 'hello,

working on new upgrades...

regards.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2018, 2, 7, 13, 20, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 364667961, 'issue_id': 287670173, 'author': 'Ali-Razmjoo', 'body': 'Hello,

there is a fundamental problem in multithreading in this framework. last night I push some [codes](https://github.com/viraintel/OWASP-Nettacker/tree/0c9147d248a1bf747d0ea5470a36c8455b058942) to enable an option if the user wants to use multi-threading instead of multiprocessing.

this is how the framework was working:
![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7676267/36063615-5325fa50-0e94-11e8-9a28-954c46a9488d.jpg)

in the first view, it's fast! because it's using multi-core of CPU for scanning each target with each module.  in the real test, I scanned 20 IPs  `192.168.1.1-192.168.1.20` in 8.458 seconds with `1000` threads and `20` processes with `1000` default ports in no ping and TCP connect mode with 2 seconds timeout. that means `20* 1000 = 20,000` requests sent in 8.458 seconds. that's powerful!! but let's do it with `1` single port. I used the same IP range and it takes 5.997 seconds (almost 6 seconds) and it's just sent `20` requests. it's because of "multiprocessing". threads are faster than opening a new process.

new codes working like this:
![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7676267/36063948-0e7cca6e-0e99-11e8-86ed-e335efe9ce1b.jpg)

I've tried this 20 IPs with the single port with the [code](https://github.com/viraintel/OWASP-Nettacker/tree/0c9147d248a1bf747d0ea5470a36c8455b058942) I contributed last night it took only 3.335 seconds! (used one core of CPU (2% maybe))

I've also retest with `1000` default ports it took 14.553 seconds (used 100% of one core of CPU).  it's using threads instead of process. it's faster then we'd open more main threads for **short times**. 


but there were some issues that made me revert the codes I pushed.
* framework must know when we've to use threading or multiprocessing.
* when the framework uses multiprocessing, it's using max thread number in each module, that means we used `-t 1000` that means use `1000` threads for connecting to a host, but if you use `port_scan` and `ssh_brute`, it would let them create 1000 threads each!

after I pushed my codes in the master branch I released that
* codes are not working well on python 3
* codes will not be compatible if future to creating blocks in defined size, (I was using a class to keep thread numbers for each host in a `dict`, and then after we create new process we could not access the shared `dict`) 

so the whole master branch was WC and I revert the codes pushed to unfuck the situation. I created a `dev` branch for testing fundamentals commits.

what's best we need to do?
somehow we must estimate the time and usage of targets depend on selected modules and the requests they will make, then separate them to blocks (with defined size), open each block in a new process, and each process opens the threads.

if anyone would like to help on this one, I appreciate your ideas and contributions.

Best Regards.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2018, 2, 10, 16, 25, 48, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 863777290, 'issue_id': 287670173, 'author': 'Rohan-Salwan', 'body': 'Hii Ali, 
I would love to do work on this issue but for that I need your clear point of view you about what you are really expecting from contributor in this issue so please ellaborate it. Ali-Razmjoo (Issue Creator) on (2018-02-07 13:20:46 UTC): hello,

Ali-Razmjoo (Issue Creator) on (2018-02-10 16:25:48 UTC): Hello,

there is a fundamental problem in multithreading in this framework. last night I push some [codes](https://github.com/viraintel/OWASP-Nettacker/tree/0c9147d248a1bf747d0ea5470a36c8455b058942) to enable an option if the user wants to use multi-threading instead of multiprocessing.

this is how the framework was working:
![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7676267/36063615-5325fa50-0e94-11e8-9a28-954c46a9488d.jpg)

in the first view, it's fast! because it's using multi-core of CPU for scanning each target with each module.  in the real test, I scanned 20 IPs  `192.168.1.1-192.168.1.20` in 8.458 seconds with `1000` threads and `20` processes with `1000` default ports in no ping and TCP connect mode with 2 seconds timeout. that means `20* 1000 = 20,000` requests sent in 8.458 seconds. that's powerful!! but let's do it with `1` single port. I used the same IP range and it takes 5.997 seconds (almost 6 seconds) and it's just sent `20` requests. it's because of "multiprocessing". threads are faster than opening a new process.

new codes working like this:
![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7676267/36063948-0e7cca6e-0e99-11e8-86ed-e335efe9ce1b.jpg)

I've tried this 20 IPs with the single port with the [code](https://github.com/viraintel/OWASP-Nettacker/tree/0c9147d248a1bf747d0ea5470a36c8455b058942) I contributed last night it took only 3.335 seconds! (used one core of CPU (2% maybe))

I've also retest with `1000` default ports it took 14.553 seconds (used 100% of one core of CPU).  it's using threads instead of process. it's faster then we'd open more main threads for **short times**. 


but there were some issues that made me revert the codes I pushed.
* framework must know when we've to use threading or multiprocessing.
* when the framework uses multiprocessing, it's using max thread number in each module, that means we used `-t 1000` that means use `1000` threads for connecting to a host, but if you use `port_scan` and `ssh_brute`, it would let them create 1000 threads each!

after I pushed my codes in the master branch I released that
* codes are not working well on python 3
* codes will not be compatible if future to creating blocks in defined size, (I was using a class to keep thread numbers for each host in a `dict`, and then after we create new process we could not access the shared `dict`) 

so the whole master branch was WC and I revert the codes pushed to unfuck the situation. I created a `dev` branch for testing fundamentals commits.

what's best we need to do?
somehow we must estimate the time and usage of targets depend on selected modules and the requests they will make, then separate them to blocks (with defined size), open each block in a new process, and each process opens the threads.

if anyone would like to help on this one, I appreciate your ideas and contributions.

Best Regards.

Rohan-Salwan on (2021-06-18 05:56:38 UTC): Hii Ali, 
I would love to do work on this issue but for that I need your clear point of view you about what you are really expecting from contributor in this issue so please ellaborate it. I am member of slack nettacker group so we can  continue our conversation on that platform too.

Ali-Razmjoo (Issue Creator) on (2021-09-09 20:57:24 UTC): done in #440

title: Create a local database and explorer (networks explorer)
body:
Hello everyone,

It's awesome if OWASP Nettacker could provide a local database of every scan. We can add a new key in `config.py`  named `save_results_in_local_database` and set default value as `True` .

what are the local DB and explorer is all about? I've seen some websites ([shodan.io](https://www.shodan.io), [censys.io](https://censys.io/)) and opensource project [ivre](https://ivre.rocks/). They are a great explorer for the internet networks (internet/...). It would be supreme if we add one to the project. we may also do it right after finishing the API.

Let me know if there is any question.
Regards.
author: Ali-Razmjoo

title: A better HTML report
body:
Hello everyone,

Right now the framework supports three types of outputs. `JSON`, `Text` and `HTML`. the HTML can handle a graph also. `d3_tree_v1_graph`, `d3_tree_v2_graph`, `jit_circle_v1_graph`. But it's not nice at all! I glad if someone could help me with a better HTML output.

To see how the framework is creating an HTML report, check the `core/log.py`.

Let me know if there is any question.

Regards.

title: OWASP Nettacker API
body:
Hello everyone,

OWASP Nettacker doesn't have any API at the moment so It's best to develop one! The purpose to design an API is that we can provide more user interfaces and controllers.

where are the events? all events that we'd show to users are using `core.alert` to print on the command line in one of these types: `info`, `warn`, `error`, `write`. also, every thread and events will save in the output file with `JSON` structure. output filename by default is like `results/results_date_random_chars.html` -> `results_2018_01_11_08_05_56_mkjiyjxklc.html` and it's stored in `log_in_file` variable in the framework (even if users change it with `-o` switch it's still in that variable).
example of a tcp_connect_port_scan event:
```
{
  "USERNAME": "",
  "CATEGORY": "scan",
  "HOST": "127.0.0.1",
  "DESCRIPTION": "OPEN PORT",
  "TIME": "2018-01-11 11:47:05",
  "PASSWORD": "",
  "TYPE": "tcp_connect_port_scan",
  "PORT": 1080
}
```
this `JSON` has 7 keys which are `HOST`, `PORT`, `USERNAME`, `PASSWORD`, `DESCRIPTION`, `CATEGORY`, `TIME`, `TYPE`. `TYPE` is the module name. I should notice that the keys are changing depend on the language, so if somone select Persian language, `HOST` will change to `هاست` and these replacements are available in `core/languages.py`.

```
{
  "درگاه": 1080,
  "هاست": "127.0.0.1",
  "کلمه عبور": "",
  "دسته": "scan",
  "نوع": "tcp_connect_port_scan",
  "زمان": "2018-01-11 11:47:36",
  "نام کاربری": "",
  "توضیحات": "درگاه باز"
}
```

replacements:

```
_HOST = messages(language, 53)
_USERNAME = messages(language, 54)
_PASSWORD = messages(language, 55)
_PORT = messages(language, 56)
_TYPE = messages(language, 57)
_DESCRIPTION = messages(language, 58)
_TIME = messages(language, 115)
_CATEGORY = messages(language, 116)
```
to check the replacements you can open the `core/languages.py` and look for the keys. `_HOST` key is`53` so it's (default: "en"):
```
{
  "53": {
    "ru": "хозяин",
    "fr": "HÔTE",
    "en": "HOST",
    "nl": "HOST",
    "el": "ΠΛΗΘΟΣ",
    "vi": "HOST",
    "de": "GASTGEBER",
    "tr": "HOST",
    "ps": "HOST",
    "ur": "HOST",
    "fa": "هاست",
    "ja": "ホスト",
    "hi": "मेज़बान",
    "zh-cn": "主办",
    "ko": "숙주",
    "it": "OSPITE",
    "hy": "HOST",
    "ar": "مضيف",
    "id": "TUAN RUMAH",
    "es": "ANFITRIÓN"
  }
}
```

at the end, I should mention that the default language is always "en" except if a user changes it with command line or config file. the language value stores in `language` variable in the framework. if a value doesn't have any replacement in other languages, you may use `en`.

let me know if there is any question.

Regards.
author: Ali-Razmjoo
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 360412724, 'issue_id': 287665207, 'author': 'Ali-Razmjoo', 'body': 'Hello,

API for submitting new task(s) (new scan) is completed.

Switches:
```
API:
  API options

  --start-api           start the API service
  --api-host API_HOST   API host address
  --api-port API_PORT   API port number
  --api-debug-mode      API debug mode
  --api-access-key API_ACCESS_KEY
                        API access key
  --api-client-white-list
                        just allow white list hosts to connect to the API
  --api-client-white-list-ips API_CLIENT_WHITE_LIST_IPS
                        define white list hosts, separate with "," (examples:
                        127.0.0.1, 192.168.0.1/24, 10.0.0.1-10.0.0.255)
  --api-access-log      generate API access log
  --api-access-log-filename API_ACCESS_LOG_FILENAME
                        API access log filename

```
* default `--api-host` is `127.0.0.1`, it could be change to `0.0.0.0` or any host!
* default ` --api-port` is `5000`
* use `--api-debug-mode` to enable API debugging
* default `--api-access-key`  is a random `MD5`, but you may change it with this switch, please notice that choose something hard to prevent brute force!
* `--api-client-white-list` is false by default
* `--api-client-white-list-ips` is set to `["127.0.0.1", "10.0.0.0/24", "192.168.1.1-192.168.1.255"]` by default. you can give the list separate with `,`. `127.0.0.1,10.0.0./24`
* Note: access log is not working yet!


**How to use the API?**
* Run the API `python nettacker.py --start-api`
* you will get the API Key printed on the screen
```
C:\Users\Zombie\Documents\GitHub\OWASP-Nettacker>python nettacker.py --start-api

   ______          __      _____ _____
  / __ \ \        / /\    / ____|  __ \
 | |  | \ \  /\  / /  \  | (___ | |__) |
 | |  | |\ \/  \/ / /\ \  \___ \|  ___/
 | |__| | \  /\  / ____ \ ____) | |     Version 0.0.1
  \____/   \/  \/_/    \_\_____/|_|     SAME
                          _   _      _   _             _
                         | \ | |    | | | |           | |
  github.com/viraintel   |  \| | ___| |_| |_ __ _  ___| | _____ _ __
  owasp.org              | . ` |/ _ \ __| __/ _` |/ __| |/ / _ \ '__|
  viraintel.com          | |\  |  __/ |_| || (_| | (__|   <  __/ |
                         |_| \_|\___|\__|\__\__,_|\___|_|\_\___|_|



 * API Key: 8370bd0a0b9a98ac25b341833fb0fb07
 * Running on http://127.0.0.1:5000/ (Press CTRL+C to quit)
```
* you must send API key through the request each time you send a request in `GET` or `POST` in the value named `key` or you will get `401` error.

```
>>> import requests
>>> r = requests.get('http://127.0.0.1:5000')
>>> r.status_code
401
>>> print r.content
{
  "msg": "invalid API key",
  "status": "error"
}

>>> r = requests.get('http://127.0.0.1:5000/?key=8370bd0a0b9a98ac25b341833fb0fb07')
>>> r.status_code
200
>>> print r.content
{
  "msg": "please read documentations https://github.com/viraintel/OWASP-Nettacker/wiki",
  "status": "ok"
}

>>> r = requests.post('http://127.0.0.1:5000/', data={"key": "8370bd0a0b9a98ac25b341833fb0fb07"})
>>> r.status_code
200
>>> print r.content
{
  "msg": "please read documentations https://github.com/viraintel/OWASP-Nettacker/wiki",
  "status": "ok"
}

>>>
```

* Note: all HTTP keys could be sent with the `GET` or `POST` request.
* New scan must be submitted to `/new/scan` URL path in `GET` or `POST` request.

```
>>> r = requests.post('http://127.0.0.1:5000/new/scan', data={"key": "8370bd0a0b9a98ac25b341833fb0fb07", "targets": "127.0.0.1,owasp.org", "scan_method": "tcp_connect_p
ort_scan"})
>>> r.status_code
200
>>> print r.content
{
  "check_ranges": false,
  "check_subdomains": false,
  "graph_flag": "d3_tree_v2_graph",
  "language": "en",
  "log_in_file": "results/results_2018_01_25_12_58_27_oefugjlsak.html",
  "methods_args": null,
  "passwds": null,
  "ping_flag": false,
  "ports": null,
  "profile": null,
  "retries": 3,
  "scan_id": "dab63b8db15268293942e8ac2b1c3129",
  "scan_method": [
    "tcp_connect_port_scan"
  ],
  "socks_proxy": null,
  "targets": [
    "owasp.org",
    "127.0.0.1"
  ],
  "thread_number": 100,
  "thread_number_host": 30,
  "time_sleep": 0.0,
  "timeout_sec": 3,
  "users": null,
  "verbose_level": 0
}

>>>
```

* Note: `targets` and `scan_method` are necessary.
* Note: `scan_method` could be empty if you define the `profile`

```
>>> r = requests.post('http://127.0.0.1:5000/new/scan', data={"key": "8370bd0a0b9a98ac25b341833fb0fb07"})
>>> print r.content
{
  "msg": "Cannot specify the target(s)",
  "status": "error"
}

>>> r = requests.post('http://127.0.0.1:5000/new/scan', data={"key": "8370bd0a0b9a98ac25b341833fb0fb07", "targets": "127.0.0.1"})
>>> print r.content
{
  "msg": "please choose your scan method!",
  "status": "error"
}

>>> r = requests.post('http://127.0.0.1:5000/new/scan', data={"key": "8370bd0a0b9a98ac25b341833fb0fb07", "targets": "127.0.0.1", "scan_method": "dir_scan,tcp_connect_port_scan"})
>>> print r.content
{
  "check_ranges": false,
```

comment_thread:
Ali-Razmjoo (Issue Creator) on (2018-01-25 09:37:51 UTC): Hello,

API for submitting new task(s) (new scan) is completed.

Switches:
```
API:
  API options

  --start-api           start the API service
  --api-host API_HOST   API host address
  --api-port API_PORT   API port number
  --api-debug-mode      API debug mode
  --api-access-key API_ACCESS_KEY
                        API access key
  --api-client-white-list
                        just allow white list hosts to connect to the API
  --api-client-white-list-ips API_CLIENT_WHITE_LIST_IPS
                        define white list hosts, separate with "," (examples:
                        127.0.0.1, 192.168.0.1/24, 10.0.0.1-10.0.0.255)
  --api-access-log      generate API access log
  --api-access-log-filename API_ACCESS_LOG_FILENAME
                        API access log filename

```
* default `--api-host` is `127.0.0.1`, it could be change to `0.0.0.0` or any host!
* default ` --api-port` is `5000`
* use `--api-debug-mode` to enable API debugging
* default `--api-access-key`  is a random `MD5`, but you may change it with this switch, please notice that choose something hard to prevent brute force!
* `--api-client-white-list` is false by default
* `--api-client-white-list-ips` is set to `["127.0.0.1", "10.0.0.0/24", "192.168.1.1-192.168.1.255"]` by default. you can give the list separate with `,`. `127.0.0.1,10.0.0./24`
* Note: access log is not working yet!


**How to use the API?**
* Run the API `python nettacker.py --start-api`
* you will get the API Key printed on the screen
```
C:\Users\Zombie\Documents\GitHub\OWASP-Nettacker>python nettacker.py --start-api

   ______          __      _____ _____
  / __ \ \        / /\    / ____|  __ \
 | |  | \ \  /\  / /  \  | (___ | |__) |
 | |  | |\ \/  \/ / /\ \  \___ \|  ___/
 | |__| | \  /\  / ____ \ ____) | |     Version 0.0.1
  \____/   \/  \/_/    \_\_____/|_|     SAME
                          _   _      _   _             _
                         | \ | |    | | | |           | |
  github.com/viraintel   |  \| | ___| |_| |_ __ _  ___| | _____ _ __
  owasp.org              | . ` |/ _ \ __| __/ _` |/ __| |/ / _ \ '__|
  viraintel.com          | |\  |  __/ |_| || (_| | (__|   <  __/ |
                         |_| \_|\___|\__|\__\__,_|\___|_|\_\___|_|



 * API Key: 8370bd0a0b9a98ac25b341833fb0fb07
 * Running on http://127.0.0.1:5000/ (Press CTRL+C to quit)
```
* you must send API key through the request each time you send a request in `GET` or `POST` in the value named `key` or you will get `401` error.

```
401
{
  "msg": "invalid API key",
  "status": "error"
}

200
{
  "msg": "please read documentations https://github.com/viraintel/OWASP-Nettacker/wiki",
  "status": "ok"
}

200
{
  "msg": "please read documentations https://github.com/viraintel/OWASP-Nettacker/wiki",
  "status": "ok"
}

```

* Note: all HTTP keys could be sent with the `GET` or `POST` request.
* New scan must be submitted to `/new/scan` URL path in `GET` or `POST` request.

```
ort_scan"})
200
{
  "check_ranges": false,
  "check_subdomains": false,
  "graph_flag": "d3_tree_v2_graph",
  "language": "en",
  "log_in_file": "results/results_2018_01_25_12_58_27_oefugjlsak.html",

```

* Note: `targets` and `scan_method` are necessary.
* Note: `scan_method` could be empty if you define the `profile`

```

منوی راهنمای Nettacker

Options:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit

  انجین:
    گزینه های ورودی انجین

    -L LANGUAGE, --language=LANGUAGE
                        لطفا یک زبان انتخاب کنید ['fa', 'en']
    -v VERBOSE_LEVEL, --verbose=VERBOSE_LEVEL
                        سطح حالت پرگویی (0-5) (پیشفرض 0)
    -V, --version       نمایش ورژن نرم افزار
    -c, --update        چک کردن جهت آپدیت
    -o LOG_IN_FILE, --output=LOG_IN_FILE
                        ذخیره کردن کل لاگ ها در فایل (result.txt، result.html)

  هدف:
    گزینه های ورودی هدف

    -i TARGETS, --targets=TARGETS
                        لیست هدف (ها)، با "," جدا کنید
    -l TARGETS_LIST, --targets-list=TARGETS_LIST
                        خواندن هدف (ها) از فایل

  Method:
    گزینه های متود های اسکن

    -m SCAN_METHOD, --method=SCAN_METHOD
                        متود اسکن را انتخاب کنید ['smtp_brute', 'http_brute',
                        'ftp_brute', 'ssh_brute', 'port_scan', 'all']
    -x EXCLUDE_METHOD, --exclude=EXCLUDE_METHOD
                        انتخاب متود اسکن استثنا ['smtp_brute', 'http_brute',
                        'ftp_brute', 'ssh_brute', 'port_scan']
    -u USERS, --usernames=USERS
                        لیست نام کاربری (ها)، با "," جدا شود
    -U USERS_LIST, --users-list=USERS_LIST
                        خواندن نام کاربری (ها) از لیست
    -p PASSWDS, --passwords=PASSWDS
                        لیست کلمه عبور (ها)، با "," جدا شود
    -P PASSWDS_LIST, --passwords-list=PASSWDS_LIST
                        خواندن کلمه عبور (ها) از فایل
    -g PORTS, --ports=PORTS
                        لیست درگاه (ها)، با "," جدا شود
    -T TIMEOUT_SEC, --timeout=TIMEOUT_SEC
                        خواندن کلمه عبور (ها) از فایل
    -w TIME_SLEEP, --time-sleep=TIME_SLEEP
                        زمان مکث بین هر درخواست
    -r, --range         اسکن کل آی پی ها در رنج
    -s, --sub-domains   یافتن و اسکن کردن ساب دامین ها
    -t THREAD_NUMBER, --thread-connection=THREAD_NUMBER
                        تعداد ریسه ها برای ارتباطات با یک هاست
    -M THREAD_NUMBER_HOST, --thread-hostscan=THREAD_NUMBER_HOST
                        تعداد ریسه ها برای اسکن هاست ها
    -R PROXIES, --proxy=PROXIES
                        لیست پروکسی (ها)، جدا سازی به وسیله "," (ارتباطات
                        خروجی)
    --proxy-list=PROXIES_FILE
                        خواندن پروسی ها از فایل (ارتباطات خروجی)
    --retries=RETRIES   سعی مجدد وقتی که ارتباط قطع شد (پیشفرض 3)
```

```
                        वर्बोस मोड स्तर (0-5) (डिफ़ॉल्ट 0)
  -V, --version         सॉफ़्टवेयर संस्करण दिखाएं
  -c, --update          अपडेट के लिये जांचें
  -o LOG_IN_FILE, --output LOG_IN_FILE
                        फ़ाइल में सभी लॉग्स को बचाएं (results.txt,
                        results.html)
  --graph GRAPH_FLAG    सभी गतिविधियों और सूचनाओं का एक ग्राफ़ बनाएं, आपको
                        HTML आउटपुट का उपयोग करना चाहिए। उपलब्ध ग्राफ़:
                        ['jit_circle_v1_graph', 'd3_tree_v2_graph',
                        'd3_tree_v1_graph']
  -h, --help            नेटटेकर सहायता मेनू दिखाएं

लक्ष्य:
  लक्षित इनपुट विकल्प

  -i TARGETS, --targets TARGETS
                        लक्ष्य सूची, "," से अलग
  -l TARGETS_LIST, --targets-list TARGETS_LIST
                        फ़ाइल से लक्ष्य (ओं) को पढ़ें

Method:
  विधि विकल्प स्कैन करें

  -m SCAN_METHOD, --method SCAN_METHOD
                        स्कैन पद्धति का चयन करें ['ssh_brute', 'ftp_brute',
                        'smtp_brute', 'port_scan', 'all']
  -x EXCLUDE_METHOD, --exclude EXCLUDE_METHOD
                        को बाहर करने के लिए स्कैन विधि चुनें ['ssh_brute',
                        'ftp_brute', 'smtp_brute', 'port_scan']
  -u USERS, --usernames USERS
                        उपयोक्ता नाम सूची, "," से अलग
  -U USERS_LIST, --users-list USERS_LIST
                        फ़ाइल से उपयोगकर्ता नाम पढ़ें
  -p PASSWDS, --passwords PASSWDS
                        पासवर्ड (एस) सूची, "," से अलग
  -P PASSWDS_LIST, --passwords-list PASSWDS_LIST
                        फ़ाइल से पासवर्ड (नों) पढ़ें
  -g PORTS, --ports PORTS
                        पोर्ट (एस) सूची, "," से अलग
  -T TIMEOUT_SEC, --timeout TIMEOUT_SEC
                        फ़ाइल से पासवर्ड (नों) पढ़ें
  -w TIME_SLEEP, --time-sleep TIME_SLEEP
                        प्रत्येक अनुरोध के बीच सो जाने का समय
  -r, --range           श्रेणी में सभी आईपी स्कैन करें
  -s, --sub-domains     उपडोमेन ढूंढें और स्कैन करें
  -t THREAD_NUMBER, --thread-connection THREAD_NUMBER
                        मेजबान के लिए कनेक्शन के लिए धागा संख्या
  -M THREAD_NUMBER_HOST, --thread-hostscan THREAD_NUMBER_HOST
                        स्कैन होस्ट के लिए थ्रेड नंबर
  -R PROXIES, --proxy PROXIES
                        प्रॉक्सी (एस) सूची, "," से अलग (बाहर जा रहे कनेक्शन)
  --proxy-list PROXIES_FILE
                        एक फ़ाइल से प्रॉक्सी पढ़ें (आउटगोइंग कनेक्शन)
  --retries RETRIES     कनेक्शन टाइमआउट (डिफ़ॉल्ट 3) के पुन: प्रयास
  --ping-before-scan    मेजबान को स्कैन करने से पहले पिंग

[X] लक्ष्य निर्दिष्ट नहीं किया जा सकता
```

title: Add Documents, Improve Wiki, Add Training Videos
body:
Hello everyone,

OWASP Nettacker doesn't have any documents or wiki right now, It's best we start Developers/Users documents to make it more friendly.

I glad if anyone can help on this! (start from [wiki](https://github.com/viraintel/OWASP-Nettacker/wiki))
author: Ali-Razmjoo
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 356832913, 'issue_id': 253185752, 'author': 'Ali-Razmjoo', 'body': 'Hi,

I just improved the wiki a little bit. but still, it needs really many things to add. adding training videos for users and developers would be great!

Regards.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2018, 1, 11, 5, 46, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 358794161, 'issue_id': 253185752, 'author': 'Ali-Razmjoo', 'body': "Hello,

I made the first GIF demo with simple commands.  If anyone would like to help here, I'll glad to receive more videos/gif/documents.

![2018-01-19_0-45-07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7676267/35123376-283d5a3e-fcb7-11e7-9b1c-92b78ed4fecc.gif)

Regards.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2018, 1, 18, 21, 54, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 366123545, 'issue_id': 253185752, 'author': 'Tikam02', 'body': '@Ali-Razmjoo  i would like to contribute and make a readthedocs documentation and wiki pages for Nettacker.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2018, 2, 16, 1, 57, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 366421504, 'issue_id': 253185752, 'author': 'Ali-Razmjoo', 'body': 'Hello,

Probably I should work on them to write the first version of documents, after that, you may contribute for corrections, update, video tutorials and etc.

Best Regards.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2018, 2, 17, 6, 37, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 367037074, 'issue_id': 253185752, 'author': 'ThorodanBrom', 'body': '@Ali-Razmjoo what have you used to make the GIFs? I was going to try it our myself, and am thinking of using [asciinema](https://asciinema.org/)', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2018, 2, 20, 16, 36, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 367058488, 'issue_id': 253185752, 'author': 'Tikam02', 'body': 'If using kali Linux there is already a built-in video recording plugin, and ubuntu also has lots of video and gif creators apps.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2018, 2, 20, 17, 43, 37, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 368293805, 'issue_id': 253185752, 'author': 'Ali-Razmjoo', 'body': 'Hello,

@ThorodanBrom asciinema is also a great thing for making tutorials. I made them with snagit on windows. there are several tools for any OS. let me know if you need more information, just share us more details.

@Tikam02 thank you for guides

Regards.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2018, 2, 25, 9, 1, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 382809444, 'issue_id': 253185752, 'author': 'Ali-Razmjoo', 'body': 'Hey, thanks to @pradeepjairamani 

new gif - api usage.
![output_pmq3sj](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7676267/39006688-118f7f0c-4419-11e8-874a-c417f0bd9081.gif)

regards.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2018, 4, 19, 17, 3, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 382906385, 'issue_id': 253185752, 'author': 'pradeepjairamani', 'body': '![webp net-gifmaker 1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24669027/39022564-bf96bde2-4453-11e8-9814-c30db364aa4d.gif)

New giif - Wizard usage', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2018, 4, 19, 23, 2, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 383221677, 'issue_id': 253185752, 'author': 'Ali-Razmjoo', 'body': 'Hey @Tikam02,

The [wiki](https://github.com/zdresearch/OWASP-Nettacker/wiki) is almost done, let me know if you would like to work on readthedocs.
